title: Campus Shoes - Senior Role - Industrial Relations
description:
Senior Role in Industrial Relations (IR)


Role Overview/ Job Purpose:


- Oversees the design, implementation and maintenance of organizations labor relations program and policies. Represent the organization in labor-management relations, including contract negotiations and arbitration cases and establish policies for reporting and addressing grievances.

Key Responsibilities:

- Devising HR policies & Implementing best HR Practices and tools for meeting existing and future business needs;

- Drive clear IR Strategy with a strong Corporate Governance, Statutory Compliances and Ethics oriented approach across the organization

- Based on work force planning & organizations needs, ensure cost effective sourcing & screening best available talent thought Employee Referrals, Job portals, Placement consultants, Contractors , campus hiring etc.

- Identify training needs, Preparation of training modules, calendar, schedules and batches for imparting training. Budgeting for training & measurement of its effectiveness.

- Design & execute effective employee engagement initiatives ; Improve Involvement & results on various activities like Kaizens, Quality Circle, 5S drives, TPM as well as various events & Celebrations to keep employee engaged & productive

- Devise & restructure compensation package in accordance with the Compensation Strategies and in alignment of applicable labour laws/statutes and overall management of salary & wages within the organisation while ensuring pay parity w.r.t Job Roles & Job pricing.

- Define and implement clear IR strategy to ensure Industrial Peace and Zero manhour loss due to of any IR issues, Set up communication channels & a strong Grievance Redressal Mechanism to proactively avert any probable IR issues; At the same time, keep a strong & effective strong IR set up to handle any adverse IR Scenario in the organization.

- Responsible for various acts/statutes & ensure 100% statutory compliances in line with organizational applicability eg. PF, ESI, Dept of Labour & Employment, Chief Inspector of Factories, Pollution control board, Chief Controller of Explosives, Fire, Employment Exchange, Weights & Measurements, local police & district administration etc.;

- Ensure smooth operations of Plant Administration & facilities like Security, Canteen, Transport facilities, Office Equipment, printing & stationary, courier, postage, IT, phones, for operational readiness and initiating cost effectiveness towards all above including electricity, water, insurance etc

Desired Skills:

- Extensive experience in labor relations, collective bargaining, and conflict resolution, with a minimum of 5-10yrs in a managerial role.

- Strong experience in dealing with unions, labor laws and regulations.

- Strong knowledge of policies and procedures.

- In-depth knowledge of Employment legislation.

- Proven ability to maintain composure in high pressure situations and resolve conflicts effectively.

- High degree of professional ethics and integrity

- Sound judgement and ability to analyze situations and information.

- Outstanding communication skills

Qualification: MBA (HR or IR), Masters in Social Work or PGDM (IR)

Working Days: Monday to Saturday (2 Saturday off)

Location: Gurgaon and Delhi (Peeragarhi)

Note: Candidates from manufacturing background only will be considered. Plus looking for immediate joiners only.

title: Zetwerk - HR Business Partner
description:
HRBP


About Zetwerk:


Zetwerk is the largest global manufacturing network for custom manufacturing that helps transform digital designs into physical manifestations.

Zetwerk offers manufacturing solutions across a diverse range of products, from simple items like steel pipes to complex products like aircraft engine components, from industrial use-cases like metal bridges, oil rigs, aircraft/auto components to consumer use-cases like apparel, home appliances, audio-visual electronics, for small businesses and Fortune 500 companies alike. Zetwerk offers customers access to a wide range of manufacturing capabilities, including metal fabrication, CNC machining, plastic injection moulding, 3D printing and aluminum die castings, across 1000s of manufacturing partners. These capabilities serve a diverse set of industries ranging from traditional ones such as Oil & Gas, Energy, Infrastructure, Aerospace, Apparel to modern ones such as Renewables, Electric Vehicles, Consumer Electronics, and Space. For customers, Zetwerk's global manufacturing network ensures products are manufactured faster, at competitive prices and with world-class quality. It offers quality monitoring through indigenously developed technology which provides end-to-end transparency from purchase orders to delivery, thus eliminating uncertainties around quality, visibility, reliability, and under-utilized capacities. For manufacturing partners, the Zetwerk platform drives higher capacity utilization of manufacturing capacities and offers various portfolio services (including logistics, raw material procurement, working capital access) to drive revenue growth as well as optimize for cost of manufacturing.

Technology + Manufacturing:

- Over the last 3 years, Zetwerk has built a strong technology driven supply chain to deliver high quality manufacturing of various industrial and consumer products at highly competitive costs and lead times. Zetwerk's in-house Manufacturing Operating System software, ZISO, enables digital selection of supply, pricing recommendations, digital repository of engineering designs, real-time tracking of manufacturing across various stages, visual updates of products getting made, seamless communication across stakeholders and quality assurance of the final product getting shipped. Our software led approach unifies various stakeholders in the manufacturing universe to collaborate to deliver the products we see around us and we love. These include product designers, manufacturing partners, logistics providers, third-party quality inspectors, financing partners, raw material suppliers and many more. Zetwerk unifies the highly fragmented manufacturing ecosystem to work as one single entity to deliver the highest quality manufacturing with the fastest possible lead times and the lowest possible costs, day in day out.


- Why Zetwerk A company that's changing the way manufacturing is done needs game changers to shape the future. At Zetwerk, our job is to help you excel in your career and make an Impact. We offer you an environment to create a unique career journey, opportunities to grow your ambition and an inclusive culture to help you thrive. We encourage innovation through collaboration and connect you to leaders who help you go beyond. We deliver the best for our people so that they can deliver the best for our customers. It's that simple. It's Zetwerk


Why Zetwerk:

A company that's changing the way manufacturing is done needs game changers to shape the future. At Zetwerk, our job is to help you excel in your career and make an Impact. We offer you an environment to create a unique career journey, opportunities to grow your ambition and an inclusive culture to help you thrive. We encourage innovation through collaboration and connect you to leaders who help you go beyond. We deliver the best for our people so that they can deliver the best for our customers. It's that simple. It's Zetwerk.

Job Location - Bangalore

EXPERTISE AND QUALIFICATIONS:

- Partner with business on workforce planning, succession planning, and skills assessment.

- Review and analyze business unit data to identify trends and recommend solutions to improve performance, retention, and employee experience.

- Work with line managers and employees to address all types of employee issues.

- Implement/administer/interpret corporate policies/programs/procedures.

- Plan, manage and provide continuous improvement to all aspects of performance management and talent development.

- Partner with managers to retain, develop and motivate people to achieve their fullest potential. - Assess, create and implement employee engagement initiatives.

- Provide ongoing support to the leadership team on human resources related matters, policies and procedures.

- Ability to influence and partner with different levels of the organization to achieve results

- Strong business and HR acumen, including strong problem solving skills, critical thinking, and self-initiative.

- Demonstrated ability to coach managers and supervisors to use company best practices for maximum effectiveness.

- Excellent written, verbal communication, interpersonal skills; high quality document and report preparation - Excellent presentation skills and knowledge of employment laws.

- Proven ability to successfully work as a team member and to build and maintain a positive work environment.

- Experience working in an entrepreneurial environment requiring strong multi-tasking abilities.

- Proven understanding of the role and functions of a human resource office within a corporate operations structure.

title: L'Oreal - Regional HR Role
description:
The world leader in cosmetics, L'Oreal is present in 150 countries on five continents. Our 36 international brands have allowed us to devote ourselves solely to one business: beauty, with a mission to provide the best in cosmetics innovation to all women and men globally. Our ambition is to win over another one billion consumers around the world by inventing the cosmetic products that meet the infinite diversity of their needs and desires through continued digital innovation. L'Oreal supports diversity and sustainable, ethical sourcing for all our products and we have reduced our emissions by approx. 78% since 2005.

The DNA of L'Oreal is Innovation and we are driven by a real passion for the future. Our Research and Innovation Centres in India are the sixth innovation hub for L'Oreal worldwide to fuel local market innovations.

The distance between beauty and tech is closing rapidly, and we are determined to be pioneers in this new beauty tech world. New digital technologies and services are making the world of beauty move faster than ever before. Data and artificial intelligence are opening new horizons for personalization and customization. By incorporating digital into everything that we do, we are creating a better relationship with our consumers.


When beauty and tech collide, the impossible can happen!


In our journey, we are looking for talented individuals who can lead us on this mission.


Would you like to be a part of the adventure?


We have a suitable opening in the function of Human Resources for the position of Regional HR. In this individual contributor role, the person will be completely responsible for the people management, acting as an adviser and providing professional support for all HR related activities. The candidate should have 2 - 4 years of relevant HRBP experience. Candidates with strong recruitment background will be given preference. The details of the same are given below:

Key Deliverables:

Talent Acquisition:

- Plan and execute the region's hiring plans including entry-level recruitment for the Sales & Education teams.

- Responsible for Onboarding and orientation of all the new joiners in partnership with the Sales team.

Talent Engagement:

- Drive employee engagement programs through proactive and structured interventions

- Handle grievances and concerns with empathy and bring them to closure

- Keeps a proactive check on the general employee well-being engagement levels and intervene actively when necessary

Learning & Development:

- Plan and execute the training development programs as per Corporate LD Calendar

- Actively build a culture of learning by sharing best practices and knowledge-sharing across the region.

Performance Management:

- Partner with the line managers to address performance gaps and facilitates discussions/processes to assess appropriate action

- Guide Line Managers on all aspects of performance management including feedback and performance coaching

Process Compliance:

- Partner with HR COE teams to drive HR agendas in the region.

- Provide timely feedback/inputs to the COE teams on the policies and processes.

- Participate in key HR projects in the areas of Rewards, Learning & Development, Engagement etc.

Professional Competencies

- Ability to manage diverse stakeholders.

- Ability to coach and mentor sales employees, having a strong sales acumen himself/herself

- Strong Business Communication skills with the ability to influence and convince stakeholders by objectively presenting challenging views

- Proficient in handling employee issues with sensitivity, objectivity and empathy

- Proficient in data analytics, process orientations exception handling

- Team Player with the ability to network collaborate with diverse teams across locations.

Qualification:

- MBA from a Tier 1 or Tier 2 institute.

Interactions:

Internal - Regional Sales Heads, Regional Sales & Education teams, HR COEs.

External - Recruitment Consultants, Candidates.

L'Oral is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Loreal strictly prohibits discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of the individual's race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Assistant Vice President - Human Resources - Pharma/Manufacturing Firm
description:
About the job : We are seeking for an experienced senior HR leader to head our India Country HR function that supports approx 1500 employees across multi-sites and an operation hosting Global Finance and Global Shared Services including a 500+ Field Sales, Marketing, Services and Customer Support organizations. You are a critical member of our India Country Management team and will lead/support efforts in forging leadership, talent and culture in support of business needs.

Reporting to the : Vice President


Responsibilities :

- Consultant & Advisor - Support overall strategic HR objectives at local and regional levels and contribute to the successful execution of business strategies; Provide HR consulting, executive coaching, insights and solutions on people and organizational issues to the leadership team to address business challenges; Lead initiatives to brand Agilent as an Employer of Choice/Great Place to Work to attract and retain talent; Drive efforts towards further strengthening the Agilent culture and partner with local management to lead to through change. Provide consulting on performance management, development of key talent and succession planning working with/supporting Business HR; Champion organization engagement, diversity & inclusion and employee experience; Deliver required country specific communications.

- Business HR Operations Lead - Develop and implement Agilent HR policies, practices and employment contracts and programs whilst ensuring local laws compliance; Ensure labor & wage law practices are accurately applied, where appropriate; Manage local benefits (including pensions) in accordance with Global Benefits governance; Maintain knowledge of industry trends and employment legislation and ensure organization's compliance; Execute required due diligence and integration activities related to mergers, acquisitions & divestitures; Manage disciplinary/misconduct investigations and resolutions with Legal/Internal Audit and contribute to ICC; Manage employee-related local Data Privacy requirements, Diversity/EEOC requirements; Manage legal obligations associated with employee representative bodies (Unions, Employee Representatives).

- Manager - Lead and develop a team of HR professionals in-country; Contribute to the delivery of core Agilent HR training (Managing @ Agilent and local training programs) in coordination with Global Learning & Leadership Development; Partner with the Global/India Staffing to support talent acquisition activities including On-Boarding, New Employee Orientations and Mobility; Support Performance Compensation Rewards Planning and other Compensation/ Incentive programs working with Global Total Rewards; Ensure end-to-end HR service delivery by maintaining partnership across all corporate and country HR functions; Connect managers and employees with appropriate HR functions and Corporate Communications.

Requirements:

- Strategic thinking - Ability to partner with business leaders to implement solutions that solve complex business challenges to address these issues.

- HR acumen - Working knowledge of people management skills. Familiar with the entire HR service delivery chain including compliance, staffing, total rewards, learning & development. Robust understanding of current legal, regulatory and governmental labor environment.

- Business acumen - Understand organization's business strategies. Aware of relevant external business competition, conditions and trends and how to translate these into appropriate management and HR actions.

- Financial acumen - Understand drivers of shareholder value and relevant business models, and how to translate these into appropriate management and HR actions.

- Partnering and influence - A team player. Present solutions in ways that are heard, understood and supported in a global matrix reporting environment. Add insight that positively influences senior management decision-making. Communicate with clarity, conviction and confidence across regions/cultures, including upward when necessary.

- Personal credibility - Consistently offer quality advice, counsel and insight. Maintain self-esteem and that of others while directly and constructively addressing issues. Create trust and mutual respect.

- Self-understanding - Advanced self-awareness and self-confidence. Recognize personal biases. Understand own strengths and liabilities. Proactively work to develop, complement or offset personal gaps or liabilities.

Qualifications:

- Bachelors or master's degree in a related discipline, including at 12-15 years HR managerial/leadership experience gained within multinational organizations.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills

- Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

title: Providence -  Talent Sourcer
description:
How is this team contributing to vision of Providence?

The human resources team is committed to cultivate a culture of excellence aligned to the Providence values and preparing our caregivers to focus on making health for a better world and attract the brightest minds with the biggest hearts to work at Providence. We are building a world class Talent Sourcing center of excellence (CoE) that would contribute towards our growth journey. You shall be instrumental in contributing towards our growth by identifying top potential talent for the organization. You shall collaborate with our business leaders to develop an effective strategy with deep knowledge of our businesses and marketplace as a trusted advisor.

What will you be responsible for?

We are looking for a proactive and results-driven Talent Sourcer to support our recruitment efforts. The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying, engaging, and attracting top-tier talent for various positions within the organization.

- Collaborate with hiring managers to understand position requirements and develop sourcing strategies.

- Utilize various sourcing techniques (e.g., social media, job boards, networking, referrals) to identify potential candidates.

- Provide market insights to the organization on the changing hiring trends

- Screen resumes and conduct initial candidate assessments to evaluate qualifications and job fit.

- Engage with passive candidates and build a strong talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate data in the applicant tracking system (ATS)

- Provide timely and insightful feedback to candidates and internal stakeholders.

- Assist in organizing and attending recruitment events, job fairs, and networking activities.

- Stay updated on industry trends, recruitment best practices, and market intelligence to enhance sourcing strategies.

- Be the first point of contact from Talent Acquisition to identify and shortlist candidates

Who are we looking for?

- Excellent communication skills with an ability to network and engage with candidates

- 4-9 years of talent sourcing experience with knowledge of latest technologies

- Bachelors/ Master's degree in any discipline

- Ability to work in a fast paced, constantly evolving environment

title: Bajaj Allianz - Manager - Corporate HR Business Partner
description:
Manager - Corporate HRBP (Reporting to AVP)


Direct Reports - 2-3


Location - Pune (No Work From Home)


Qualification - Master's degree in Human Resource/ Psychology / Personnel Management


Work Experience :


- 8-10 years of experience in HR vertical


- Preferably 5 or more years of experience in large, cross-functional teams influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders effectively across the organization and within complex contexts


- Demonstrated experience in, organization design and development


- Ability to build a strong partnership with the business and demonstrate the business value


- Effective influencing and negotiation skills in an environment in which resources may not be in direct control of this role


- Excellent analytical, strategic conceptual thinking, strategic planning and execution skills


Job description:


Life Cycle Management:


1) Manage end to end employee life cycle, talent acquisition, Candidate on-boarding, talent integration & management, employee relations, performance & compensation management, learning & development and change management initiatives.


2) Demonstrate capability in service excellence and quality by building a capable and motivated team by driving high performance work culture.


3) Lead and manage end to end HR activities and talent agenda, counsel business leaders in people issues within the organization with the objective of nurturing and encouraging capability development.


4) Leverage digital platform to ensure adoption and drive all practices which are on platform to reduce employee calls.


Planning & Budgeting :


1) Prepare Annual Operating and Long Range Plan in consultation with the business head with respect to Manpower Head Count.


2) Track and review the cost across various metrics; Review the finalization of budget


3) Track adherence to budget and take corrective actions in case of deviations


Talent Acquisition :


1) Partner with business to close all positions for Operations Vertical through all sourcing channels.


2) Identifying potential candidates, liase with hiring managers on understanding Gaps & ensure position closure with the right fitment.


3) Recruitment Cost Reduction & Timely Hiring of Manpower to facilitate Business Growth and Revenue. Ensure better source mix and reduce dependency on consultant hiring.


4) Review the weekly reports and seek inputs in case of major abnormalities; resolve recruitment related escalated issues


5) Ensure to have Job Descriptions of each and every role and get it jobs evaluated from Comp Team.


Performance Management :


1) KPI Setting of new joinees.


2) Ensure Quarterly Assessment of KPIs with rating from respective business within timeline defined.


3) Plan and drive annual PMS within business and support in assessment completion.


4) Trouble shoot on normalization, monitor to ensure that promotions are in line with defined policies and liaise with business heads to drive closure within guidelines


Employee Engagement:


1. Plan, Execute & Monitor closure of Employee Engagement activities like - Focus Group Discussions, One on one employee discussion, connect with Hi pots, HOD/ MANCOM connect sessions on the basis of Employee Engagement Survey and design the action plan/Interventions/issues resolutions to ensure high levels of employee engagement resulting in Say & Stay, Strive.


2. Plan and Drive quarterly Rewards and Recognition for the employees in alignment with business heads


3. Drive digital adoption for seamless nomination under all reward category and deserving employee should be rewarded.


Learning Interventions -


1. Gather Training need from respective functions with respect to career path


2. Plan and ensure to drive the learning interventions for the employees within the functions basis the requirement


3. Drive digital adoption with various engaging interventions in partnership with L&D COE Team.


Attrition Management :


1. Analyze, monitor, & reduce attrition by enhancing employee experience through improved On-boarding, HR service deliveries, policies & processes and design and execute the attrition mitigation strategies.


2. Initiate practices to curb the attrition.


3. Analyze attrition data in different cohorts frequently to identify gaps and recommend solutions to reduce attrition.


4. Present attrition data to HR leaders and respective business leaders quarterly.


Employee Governance/ Conflict Management - Advocate and ensure compliance on organization's Code of Conduct, legal and FPU interface. Effectively manage and close employee grievances, escalations and investigations cases.


Exit Process: Manage and ensure exit process, including exit interviews, providing Retention measures to the business and ensuring the smooth exits of the employees.

title: PropTiger.com - Assistant Manager/Deputy Manager - HR Business Partner
description:
Assistant Manager / Deputy Manager- HR (HRBP)


Who we are.?

REA India is a part of REA Group Ltd. of Australia (ASX: REA) ("REA Group"). It is the country's leading full stack real estate technology platform that owns Housing.com, Makaan.com and PropTiger.com.

In December 2020, REA Group acquired a controlling stake in REA India. REA Group, headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, is a multinational digital advertising business specialising in property. It operates Australia's leading residential and commercial property websites, realestate.com.au and realcommercial.com.au and owns leading portals in Hong Kong (squarefoot.com.hk) and China- (myfun.com). REA Group also holds a significant minority shareholding in Move, Inc., operator of- realtor.com- in the US, and the PropertyGuru Group, operator of leading property sites in Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia.

REA India is the only player in India that offers a full range of services in the real estate space, assisting consumers through their entire home seeking journey all the way from initial search and discovery to financing to the final step of transaction closure. It offers advertising and listings products to real estate developers, agents & homeowners, exclusive sales and marketing solutions to builders, data and content services, and personalized search, virtual viewing, site visits, negotiations, home loans and post- sales services to consumers for both buying and renting.

With a 1600+ strong team, REA India has a national presence with 24 offices across India with its corporate office located in Gurugram, Haryana.

Housing.com:

Founded in 2012 and acquired by REA India in 2017, Housing.com is India's most innovative real estate advertising platform for homeowners, landlords, developers, and real estate brokers. The company offers listings for new homes, resale homes, rentals, plots and co-living spaces in India. Backed by strong research and analytics, the company's experts provide comprehensive real estate services that cover advertising and marketing, sales solutions for real estate developers, personalized search, virtual viewing, AR&VR content, home loans, end-to-end transaction services, and post-transaction services to consumers for both buying and renting.

PropTiger.com:

PropTiger.com is among India's leading digital real estate advisory firm offering a one-stop platform for buying residential real estate. Founded in 2011 with the goal to help people buy their dream homes, PropTiger.com leverages the power of information and the organisation's deep-rooted understanding of the real estate sector to bring simplicity, transparency and trust in the home buying process. PropTiger.com helps home-buyers through the entire home-buying process through a mix of technology-enabled tools as well as on-ground support. The company offers researched information about various localities and properties and provides guidance on matters pertaining to legal paperwork and loan assistance to successfully fulfil a transaction.

Makaan.com:

Makaan.com was acquired by REA India in May 2015, with a vision to establish a true "marketplace" in real estate. With consumer ratings on large number of sellers, credible listings data and real-time intelligence on property search, Makaan.com has emerged as the preferred partner for consumers looking to rent, buy or sell a home. Makaan.com offers its online consumers maximum property options and has become one of the largest advertising platforms in online real estate in India.

Our Vision:

Changing the way India experiences property.

Our Mission:

To be the first choice of our consumers and partners in discovering, renting, buying, selling, financing a home, and digitally enabling them throughout their journey. We do that with data, design, technology, and above all, the passion of our people while delivering value to our shareholders.

Our Culture:

Culture forms the core of our foundation and our effort towards creating an engaging workplace that has resulted in REA India being ranked 3rd among the coveted list of India's Best 100 Companies to Work For in 2023 by the Great Place to Work Institute- . REA India was also ranked in the top 25 workplaces in 2022 & 2021 and in top 50 in 2019. In addition, REA India was also recognized as Best Workplace- in Building a Culture of Innovation by All in 2023 and India's Best Workplaces- in Retail (e-commerce category) for the third time in 2023.

REA India is ranked 4th among Best Workplaces in Asia in 2023 and was ranked 55th in 2022, & 48th in 2021 apart from being recognized as Top 50 Best Workplaces- for Women in India in 2023 and 2021. REA India is also recognized as one of India's Top 50 Best Workplaces for Millennials in 2023 by Great Place to Work.

At REA India, we believe in creating a home for our people, where they feel a sense of belonging and purpose. By fostering a culture of inclusion and continuous learning and growth, every team member has the opportunity to thrive, embrace the spirit of being part of a global family, while contributing to revolutionize the way India experiences property. When you come to REA India, you truly COME HOME!

REA India (Housing.com, PropTiger.com, Makaan.com) is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes all qualified individuals to apply for employment. We are committed to creating an environment that is free from discrimination, harassment, and any other form of unlawful behavior. We value diversity and inclusion and do not discriminate against our people or applicants for employment based on age, color, gender, marital status, caste, religion, race, ethnic group, nationality, religious or political conviction, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, family responsibility, or disability or any other legally protected status. We firmly strive to eliminate any barriers that may impede equal opportunities while also recognizing that specific job roles may require appointees to possess the necessary qualifications, skills, abilities to perform essential functions of the position effectively.

What does this role hold for you.??

As an incumbent to this role, one would take care of the following duties:

- Align the local people initiatives with global business agenda as well as with cross business agenda within the region.

- Build a robust employee engagement strategy and drive implementation of the same.

- Support the design and execution of Reward & Recognition initiatives.

- Drive timely and fair Performance Management & Assessment.

- Development plans for key talent and corrective plans for low performers.

- Support the managers in appropriate career management of their team members.

- Identify people as well as business challenges that are possible obstacles to organizational outcomes and propose / create interventions that can bring in desired synergies

- Partner in the process of Policy formation; and ensure implementation and adherence to the policies.

- Ensure appropriate documentation to safeguard against legal and reputational risks.

- Address Employee Relations matters with regular incident management, investigation.

Know more about us.

Visit our career websites at https://careers.housing.com/ & https://careers.proptiger.com/ and LinkedIn page to know more about our company culture, and gain insights into what makes us a Great Place to Work.

title: Bajaj Electricals - Specialist - Learning & Development
description:
- Collaborate with various business verticals, functions and plants to build a learning culture and drive all learning initiatives across the organization.


- Institutionalize a Learning & Development (L&D) philosophy and culture to address knowledge and skill gaps and promote continuous unlearning and learning.


- Plan, develop, and deploy learning management platforms/systems with the help of designated technology and learning partners.


- Design & develop L&D initiatives for various talent segments.


- Design & rollout strategic learning interventions for the leadership team and their second line.


- Assess training needs and design effective training interventions to groom high potentials and employees identified for critical roles.


- Create a pool of internal facilitators who can develop learning content and facilitate behavioral, functional, skill based & experiential learning initiatives.


- Develop internal Subject Matter Experts (SME) to address future & present skill needs of the organization.


- Develop a pool of good training partners, as well as learning content repository, to support employee learning.


- Facilitate cross-functional learning, best practice sharing, and peer learning through interaction & collaboration across business units, departments, plants, branches and hierarchies.


- Ensure that the yearly learning budget is invested effectively in L&D interventions, that can drive employee development as well as organization development.


- Improve effectiveness of IDPs and induction programs.

title: Raphe mPhibr - Associate - Talent Acquisition
description:
About the company

Raphe mPhibr Pvt. Ltd is a Hi-tech Aerospace manufacturing company. We supply customized comprehensive UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle) solutions. Our innovation spreads across a broad spectrum and our research spans many advanced engineering fields. Our primary focus is to innovate and support India to become self-reliant in manufacturing. We have spurred a revolution by indigenously developing and manufacturing every subsystem that is used in a UAV.

Do you want?

- Opportunity to be part of a young and dynamic team

- Opportunity to work alongside highly innovative and technical minds

- Competitive salary based on your skills

- Outstanding career growth opportunity

Purpose of the role:

We are seeking a creative, dynamic Recruiter to join our team as the Talent Acquisition Associate. He/she will be accountable for managing many open positions and flex to address the highly diverse and at times significant volume of recruitment priorities across the organization.

Do you want to be part of a team of innovators? If yes, then let's solve the real problems and innovate the newer possibilities. Sounds interesting? Come, join us on this incredible journey!

Do not just dream about what's Next - build it!

As a Talent Acquisition Associate, you will:

- Identify the organization's needs and work to create and implement an efficient talent acquisition strategy - including Employer Brand efforts - to improve recruitment and business performance

- Work closely with hiring managers to understand key recruiting goals and milestones for the team & develop the hiring strategies.

- Visit career and job fairs.

- Plan procedures for improving the candidate's experience.

- Maintain and improve keen understanding of the requirements for each role & create job descriptions and interview questions that reflect the requirements for each position.

- Own full cycle recruitment & implement best practices in hiring issues and procedures.

- Manage searches toward optimal performance, including upgrading talent.

- Build a strong tech talent pipeline and help hire and retain skilled employees for our required positions.

Skills and competencies:

- Proficiency with recruitment through social media, C.V. databases, and professional networks

- Proven work experience as a Talent Acquisition Professional.

- Technical expertise with an ability to understand and explain job requirements for technical/non-technical roles.

- Comprehensive knowledge of current HR/talent, and the ability to think outside of what's been done before to come up with the best solution

- Strong work ethic.

- Proficiency in documenting processes and keeping up with industry trends. Ability to grow global strategies and thinking about recruiting priorities.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presenting to senior leadership teams while collaborate and leads large cross-departmental projects/initiatives.

- Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to juggle multiple tasks at the same time

- Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with people at all levels of an organization

- Adaptability - ability to learn/flex and adapt to changing business needs

- Divergent thinking - creative problem solving, ability to know the environment, and effectively use company resources to draw conclusions

- Analytical mindset- using data to tell stories and drive decisions; you seek to understand and solve a problem, you instinctively ask for the data. You are fluent with recruiting analytics and how to build and improve systems and processes around them.

Qualification and Experience:

- Master's degree in HR/LR/IR/Management or related field from Tier I or II institutes.

- 2-4 years of experience in end-to-end recruitment

title: Haleon - Specialist - HR Operations - People Services
description:
People Services Specialist

We're Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we're improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands - including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum - through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What's more, we're achieving it in a company that we're in control of. In an environment that we're co-creating. And a culture that's uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn't a question.

With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we're uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.

This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It's an opportunity to be part of something special.

Key Responsibilities:

- Support and lead employees and managers across full employee lifecycle through advisory ("how do I?") and coaching on HR procedures (process & policy) covering key topics Hire to Exit across India, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh.

- Manage end to end transitions and streamline processes working with Global Stakeholders to drive operational efficiencies.

- Headcount reporting Analytics and Use dashboard and available data analytics to ensure personal performance meets all agreed service standards.

- Work with extended HR Stakeholders to support on Key HR Process design and support on Automation projects.

- Management of cases and transactions in Service Now and Workday; acting as the single point of contact for the business and triaging to SMEs, 3rd Party HR service providers & CoEs to ensure timely resolution to meet agreed service level agreements. Drive Self service and take measures to increase penetration.

- Provide guidance to the business as well as in-country HR where needed on all Employee life cycle processes from Hire, Job Status, Terminations and any other HR key processes.

- Support employees with benefits enrolment activity through Workday and liaise with benefits providers to ensure set up and termination of benefits (including pension providers, life insurance, health insurance, other company sponsored Benefits etc.) according to policy. Complete end to end Vendor Management and Employee communication support.

- Support right to work & visa application process through initiation of vendors

Manage internal moves and create / alter contractual terms and conditions (change in reporting line, work schedules, compensation structure etc.)

- Act as the position specialist supporting creation of positions & job requisitions in Workday

- Provide support on creating an exceptional experience for New hires during Onboarding including collection of HR documentation e.g. contracts of employment, new hire forms and employee handbooks and maintenance of employee files (online in digital form & offline hardcopies)

- Responsible for continuous improvement to enhance HR services by reviewing and revising operational processes, policies, and SOPs to optimize efficiencies and accuracy of procedures. Project Manage the Transition of Activities for People Services delivery.

Qualifications and Skills:

- Ideal candidates will have 2-5 years HR Operations and/or Shared Services experience in a multi-national organisation; experience in any other Customer Support related environment also desirable

- Experience with Workday, ServiceNow or other HR systems are desirable but extensive trainings will be provided

- Customer service-based mindset and focus on getting things done

- Experience with process transitions will be a great asset

- High level of personal resilience; ability to work independently and in a team

- Ability to handle multiple activities in parallel (multitasking) in a fast-paced environment

- Capability to structure your daily work

- High level of integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality of information

- Knowledge and understanding of HR processes and procedures

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:

At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.

We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.

We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.

title: Glenmark Pharmaceuticals - Senior Manager - International Compensation
description:
Job description:

The role will be responsible for rewards across all regions outside India and 2,000+ international colleagues in 30+ countries (about 10 large countries). The role holder is expected to collaborate with stakeholders globally towards driving effectiveness compensation programs and benefits including annual compensation review, market benchmarking, global mobility, etc. The role holder will also be responsible for driving annual manpower budgeting for international locations and processes including automation.

- Highly numerate with the ability to analyze data, draw conclusions, recognize implications and generate solutions

title: Head - Global Talent Acquisition - Analytics Consulting Firm
description:
Company Overview:

Our client is a leading analytics consulting company headquartered in the US, specializing in providing cutting-edge solutions in AI, ML, and emerging technologies. With a focus on innovation and problem-solving, the company has established itself as a key player in the analytics industry.

Job Description:

We are seeking an energetic and experienced Head of Talent Acquisition to lead our recruitment efforts. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in hiring for AI, ML, and emerging technologies, coupled with a vibrant and hands-on approach to talent acquisition. If you are passionate about building high-performance teams, love solving recruitment challenges, and thrive in a dynamic environment, we invite you to join the team.

Responsibilities:

Talent Acquisition Strategy:

- Develop and execute a comprehensive talent acquisition strategy aligned with the company's goals and growth plans.

- Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices, ensuring a competitive edge in attracting top talent.

- AI, ML, and Emerging Technologies Hiring:

- Lead the recruitment efforts for roles related to AI, ML, and emerging technologies.

- Collaborate with hiring managers to understand technical requirements and skill sets, ensuring the acquisition of top-tier talent.

Team Leadership:

- Manage and mentor a team of recruiters, providing guidance and support to ensure the team's success.

- Foster a collaborative and high-performance culture within the talent acquisition team.

Hands-On Recruitment:

- Personally engage in the end-to-end recruitment process for critical roles, demonstrating a hands-on approach.

- Utilize your expertise in AI, ML, and emerging technologies to assess and identify top candidates.

Employer Branding:

- Enhance the company's employer brand to attract top talent.

- Implement innovative strategies to showcase the company's unique culture and opportunities.

Problem Solving:

- Proactively address recruitment challenges and bottlenecks, providing effective solutions.

- Drive continuous improvement in recruitment processes to streamline and optimize efficiency.

Collaboration:

- Work closely with other HR functions and departments to ensure seamless integration of talent acquisition with broader organizational goals.

Qualifications and Experience:

- Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related field; advanced degree is a plus.

- 10-18 years of progressive experience in talent acquisition, with a focus on AI, ML, and emerging technologies hiring.

- Proven track record of successfully building and leading high-performing talent acquisition teams.

- In-depth understanding of the AI and ML industry, with the ability to assess technical skills and capabilities.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

- Passion for problem-solving and a proactive approach to addressing challenges.

If you are a dynamic and experienced talent acquisition leader with a passion for AI, ML, and emerging technologies, and you are excited about contributing to the success of a leading analytics consulting company, we encourage you to apply.

description:

title: Skuad - Senior Partner - People & Culture
description:
Senior Partner - People & Culture


What will you do?


Onboarding:

- Transform onboarding into an adventure! Craft experiences that set the stage for success


- Work with hiring managers to turn new hires into instant company champions

Offboarding:

- Bid farewell with flair! Manage offboarding like a pro, turning exits into positive memories

- Ensure every departing employee feels valued on their way to new horizons

Employee Engagement:


- Ignite the spark! Lead initiatives that keep our team excited, motivated, and loving Mondays

- Be the architect of fun - from recognition programs to unforgettable events

Culture Development:

- Shape the vibe! Contribute to a culture that's not just a buzzword but a way of life

- Be the heartbeat of our organisation, ensuring everyone feels the rhythm of a positive workplace

What makes you a great match for us?

- Bachelor's/Master's degree in HR, Business, or a field that showcases your awesome

- Proven experience as an HRBP or in a role that screams, "I'm an HR rockstar!"

- Superb communication skills - because you'll be the maestro of HR symphonies

- Problem-solving prowess and a knack for turning challenges into opportunities

- Tech-savvy with proficiency in HRIS - because we're modern and forward-thinking.

About Skuad:

Imagine a world without boundaries, where companies effortlessly discover, hire, and manage talent, regardless of geographical constraints. Skuad brings this vision to life.

We're on a mission to democratize global talent and opportunities, making remote work accessible worldwide. Skuad empowers employers to effortlessly build, pay, and oversee exceptional global teams while handling the complexities of payroll, compliance, and taxation.

Our diverse, globally distributed team is passionate about fostering inclusive work cultures and enabling customers to thrive globally. Backed by leaders with over two decades of HR expertise, our goal is to create one million opportunities globally by 2027.

Having raised $15 million in Series A funding in Oct 2022, totaling $19 million with support from returning investors Beenext and Anthemis, we're committed to driving value, learning, and continuous improvement as a united global team.

With Skuad you get to have:

- Ownership: You will own what you do. We are a results-driven team, which means we expect you to get things done

- Endless support: You will always be able to reach the help you may need. You will have the resources you need to deliver

- Experiment: This is your playground. You will come up with ideas of your own, pitch them, and take them up. You will have a free hand to execute exciting ideas

- Impact: Be a part of a world-class team where we are constantly challenged with new things and maximize the impact of the products we build

Why should you join Skuad?

- Venture capital-backed hyper-growth company

- Rapid career advancement with opportunities to learn

- Competitive salary and Performance bonus

- Paid time off, Flexi-hour policy & Wellness benefits

description:

- Excellent active listening, negotiation, and presentation skills

title: GeoIQ - HR Compliance Specialist
description:
Location : HSR Layout, Bengaluru, India (Work from Office)

Job Type : Full-time

About GeoIQ : GeoIQ is India's leading hyperlocal location AI startup that helps businesses make pin-pointed decisions using bespoke location AI. The backbone of the platform is data: over 3500+ attributes covering demographics, income, infrastructure, commercial activity, rentals, etc available at street-level granularity, with 100% coverage across the country. GeoIQ has been named among the Hottest AI Startups in India (2022) by Analytics India Magazine.

Position Overview : We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented HR Compliance Specialist to join our Human Resources team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring that our organization complies with all applicable employment laws, regulations, and internal policies. The HR Compliance Specialist will work closely with HR leadership and cross-functional teams to establish, monitor, and enhance compliance processes and practices. About the team: We are a lean team of 40+ members. The founding team has a plethora of experience in data analytics, machine learning, and product development (& professional cricket!).

Key Responsibilities :

1. Legal Compliance :

- Stay abreast of federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations.

- Conduct regular audits to ensure company policies and procedures align with legal requirements.

- Collaborate with legal counsel to interpret and implement regulatory changes.

2. Policy Development and Implementation :

- Work with HR leadership to develop and update HR policies and procedures.

- Communicate policy changes to relevant stakeholders and ensure understanding and adherence.

3. Training and Education :

- Design and deliver training programs to educate employees and managers on compliance related topics.

- Provide guidance to HR and management on compliance issues and best practices.

4. Documentation and Recordkeeping :

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records related to HR compliance activities.

- Prepare and submit required reports to regulatory agencies.

5. Investigations and Resolutions :

- Conduct internal investigations into compliance concerns and employee relations matters.

- Collaborate with HR and management to address and resolve compliance issues.

6. Monitoring and Reporting :

- Establish metrics to monitor and report on HR compliance effectiveness.

- Produce regular reports for HR leadership and management on compliance-related activities.

7. Collaboration processes :

- Partner with cross-functional teams to integrate compliance considerations into business

- Work closely with HR, legal, and other departments to address compliance-related issues.

Qualifications :

- Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.

- 3+ years of experience in HR compliance roles.

- In-depth knowledge of federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong experience in Employees Grievance Handling.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.

Preferred Qualifications :

- Professional certification in HR (e.g., PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, or SHRM-SCP).

title: RP Sanjiv Goenka Group - Talent Acquisition Manager - Dr Vaidya's
description:
Company Overview:

Dr. Vaidya's is a renowned healthcare company dedicated to providing innovative and holistic solutions for well-being. With a strong foundation in Ayurveda, we blend traditional wisdom with modern science to deliver products that enhance the overall health and happiness of our customers. As we expand our team, we are seeking a motivated and skilled Talent Acquisition Specialist to play a key role in attracting and acquiring top talent for our organization.

Position Summary:

The Talent Acquisition Specialist at Dr. Vaidya's will be responsible for leading end-to-end recruitment processes to identify, engage, and hire exceptional individuals who align with our values and contribute to the success of our dynamic company.

Responsibilities:

Recruitment Strategy:

- Implement best practices to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates.

title: Senior Manager - Talent Acquisition
description:
Sr Manager- Talent Acquisition, Mumbai


Job Title/Designation : Sr Manager- Talent Acquisition, Mumbai

Employment Type : Full Time, Permanent

Job Description :

Key Responsibilities :

- Talent Acquisition & Onboarding

- Driving the full spectrum of recruiting and selection activities.

- Supervise the recruiting team and report on its performance.

- Creating and implementing talent acquisition strategies for leadership, mid-career and graduate hiring.

- Designing and driving the adoption of consistent recruiting, interviewing and hiring practices that support a strong candidate experience (People-First culture).

- Managing end-to-end recruitment for senior roles within the company.

- Implement new sourcing methods.

- Keep track of recruiting metrics (Example: cost-per-hire and time-to-hire).

- Review recruitment software and suggest the best option for company needs.

- Partnering with leaders within the organization to track ongoing and forecast future hiring needs.

- Identifying and partnering with external providers as required to ensure hiring needs are met.

- Keeping abreast with market standards, competitors and proposing how to stay ahead of the competition to attract, recruit and retain good talent.

- Work includes proper assessment, Conducting interviews, Compensation fitment and complete documentation, reference check, screening of candidates at all level for validity and authenticity as per the recruitment norms as well as Identifying critical, niche & mass positions for building a talent pipeline/backups.

- Salary positioning, offer negotiation & timely closure of positions involving aggressive follow up with candidates.

- Ensuring the background verification and Reference check process is completed for new joiners as per company guidelines

- Maintaining daily, weekly & monthly Database and Reports

- Onboarding and completing joining formalities for new joiners

- Preparing, planning & conduct induction program for new joiners

- Prepare Recruitment related MIS on monthly and quarterly basis.

BUSINESS HR ENGAGEMENT :

- Other HR Activities

- Monitoring field performance on weekly basis for further analysis

- Monthly/Quarterly MIS & preparing presentations as and when needed.

- Handling Employee Grievances with excellent people connect interpersonal and people management skills.

- Maintain monthly employee database and maintain MIS for further analysis

Key Skills Required :

- Candidate should have relevant experience of IT Recruitment

- Good interpersonal & people management skills

- Taking initiative & go getter

- Excellent oral and written communication skills

- Good knowledge of excel, PPT and Presentation Skills

title: Manager - Change Management - HR Function - Big4
description:
Your key responsibilities :

- Establish change management expertise within the practice, grow and lead a team of change and learning design specialists

- Enable delivery and execution of change management strategy for global large transformation programs in partnership with global EY offices.

- Provide advice and guidance as a subject matter expert and work effectively as part of a large distributed program team.

- Ensure high quality deliverables are produced for the project by exhaustive internal reviews and obtain excellent feedback from the client and global project counterparts

- Manage engagement risk, project economics, manage escalations and ensure effective planning and budgeting

- Lead development of thought leadership, collateral, tools, techniques, methodologies to enhance change management and broader capability offering within the practice

- Support leadership in developing the practice through collaboration with EY global offices and demand generation for change management projects

- Perform the role of a counsellor and coach, define and set goals, conduct performance reviews and ensure ongoing learning and development of the team

- Collaborate with subject matter experts across the HR service areas (learning and development, staffing, talent management, diversity, compliance) to provide insights on overall strategic and operational performance

Skills and attributes for success:

- High integrity and commitment to work in a new and challenging environment

- Ability to manage ambiguity and be proactive

- Strong communication and presentation skills

- Cross cultural awareness and sensitivity

- High energy levels, agility and adaptability

- Open to travel for client projects that are approved as per EY and country specific travel advisory guidelines

To qualify for the role, you must have:

- Postgraduate degree or equivalent with a specialization in Human Resources (India or abroad)

- 5 -16 years of relevant experience

- Experience leading change management efforts on global client projects

- A track record of designing and implementing medium - large scale change programs including HR Transformation, Human-Centered Design, Digital Strategy, and ERP Transformation

- Experience in advising and guiding clients on complex transformation programs with key domain expertise in business readiness, business adoption, change strategy, visioning, execution, stakeholder management, benefits management, and communication

- Experience in managing delivery team of at least 5+ individuals, providing advice and guidance on career development, L&D, and performance management

- Experience in learning design and content development using techniques of instructional design and application of it to enable a change program

- Experience in selling and delivering work that spans across the full project lifecycle.

title: Lead - Learning & Development - Retail/BFSI/FMCD
description:
L&D Lead job description :

Job Title : L&D Lead (Learning and Development Lead)

Job Summary :

- As an L&D Lead, you will be responsible for developing, implementing, and managing comprehensive learning and development strategies and programs within the organization. You will work closely with key stakeholders to identify learning needs, design effective training initiatives, and measure the impact of learning interventions.


- The L&D Lead plays a critical role in enhancing employee performance, supporting organizational goals, and fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.

Key Responsibilities:

Learning Needs Assessment:

- Collaborate with business leaders, HR, and subject matter experts to identify organizational learning needs and skill gaps.

- Conduct thorough needs analysis to determine the most suitable learning solutions and modalities.

Learning Program Development:

- Design and develop engaging and impactful learning programs, including e-learning courses, workshops, seminars, and blended learning approaches. Select and utilize appropriate instructional design methodologies, learning theories, and technologies to enhance the effectiveness of learning initiatives.

- Create and curate learning content, ensuring its relevance, accuracy, and alignment with organizational goals.

Learning Program Implementation:

- Coordinate the delivery of learning programs, including scheduling, logistics, and participant communication.

- Facilitate training sessions or oversee external trainers to ensure high-quality program delivery.

- Monitor and evaluate program effectiveness and make necessary improvements based on feedback and performance metrics.

Learning Management Systems (LMS):

- Administer and manage the learning management system, including course creation, user enrollment, reporting, and troubleshooting.

- Stay updated on LMS features and emerging trends in learning technologies, recommending system enhancements as needed.

Performance Support and Coaching:

- Develop performance support tools, job aids, and resources to reinforce learning and improve on-the-job performance.

- Provide coaching and guidance to employees and managers on professional development opportunities and career pathways.

Talent Development Initiatives:

- Collaborate with HR and talent management teams to support succession planning, leadership development, and high-potential programs.

- Identify and implement innovative approaches to foster a culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing.

Vendor Management:

- Evaluate and select external training vendors, consultants, or subject matter experts as needed.

- Manage vendor relationships, contracts, and budgets to ensure high-quality and cost-effective learning solutions.

Compliance and Reporting:

- Ensure learning programs comply with relevant legal and regulatory requirements.

- Generate regular reports and metrics on learning program effectiveness, participation rates, and ROI.


Education - Full Time MBA from any of the following institutes ( XISS, GIM, LIBA, XIME, TISS , XLRI , Symbiosis, NMIMS , IMT, IMI)

Experience - Experience in working / or leading a L&D Team for at least 5 years . Exposure to other areas in HR will be an added advantaged

Industry - At least one stint in Retail / BFSI/ Consumer Durables etc.

title: Director/Associate Director - Human Resources - SaaS Business - IIM/TISS/XLRI/SCMHRD
description:
Who is AiDash?

AiDash is revolutionising the way core industries, such as Utilities and Energy tackle their operations, maintenance and sustainability challenges by using the power of satellites and Artificial Intelligence (AI). We enable our customers to utilize high resolution satellite imagery for inspection and remote monitoring of geographically dispersed assets at scale. The recommendations and insights produced by our AI applications have saved our customers millions of dollars and improved overall network reliability for them and their customers.

AiDash is backed by top-tier investors, including G2 Venture Partners, Benhamou Global Ventures, National Grid Partners, Edison International, and Shell Ventures. To learn more about how AiDash is helping core industries become more resilient, efficient, and sustainable,

visit: www.aidash.com.

What's the role?

AiDash aspires to be a leader in the space of building futuristic products, based on satellite images, that provide actionable insights to help customers save millions of dollars annually.

Currently, we are a team of 200 high-calibre and passionate professionals across engineering, data science, product, analytics, GIS, customer success, sales and support functions spread across India, US and UK.

AiDash are looking for a seasoned, HR leader with the passion to build a performance driven global technology organisation. This role encompasses both HR Business Partner and HR Operations responsibilities, requiring a strategic thinker with a strong background in aligning HR initiatives with business objectives and overseeing efficient HR services delivery specific to the Indian context Role will primarily be responsible for the organization in India and asupport business leaders in the US and Europe on HR initiatives.

What you will ?

Strategic Business Partnering

- Act as an HR business partner, for company leadership across technology and product, data, and customer success functions, to understand organization goals, and develop an effective people strategy.

- Responsible for driving systemic and tactical organisational initiatives aligning with business needs and organisation priorities.

People Operations

- Own all people operations processes including, but not limited to, performance review cycles, employee engagement, compensation reviews and planning, payroll and benefits administration.

- Design and implement the requisite processes, and tools; Implement a culture of continuous improvement within the People Operations function, regularly reviewing and refining HR processes to adapt to evolving business needs and industry best practices.

- Establish a data-driven monitoring and governance framework for people operations.

- Develop and nurture the HR team, providing mentorship, training, and growth opportunities to enhance their effectiveness.

Culture

- Develop and instill a performance-driven culture that emphasizes accountability, goal-setting, and continuous improvement, aligning individual and team efforts with organizational objectives.

Recruitment / Talent Acquisition

- Leading the talent acquisition activities including defining and implementing strategies to attract, hire, and retain top talent across the company.

- Driving employer branding initiatives to establish a go-to brand for tier-one technology, data science and data consulting talent.

Learning & Development

- Develop and execute all learning and development initiatives and help drive a highperformance, high-growth mindset that focuses on career development and growth.

What are we looking for?

- 10 plus years of experience in HRBP / HR Consulting/ HR Generalist roles in a technology company, preferably a product company.

- MBA from a Premier B school with a specialization in HR.

- Proven track record in a fast-growth environment - building and scaling HR function.

- Data-driven, with strong problem-solving ability.

- Good with stakeholder management at all levels in the organization

- Tech-savvy, willing to adopt best-in-class tools and practices in the HR function

- Willing to work in a fast-paced environment.

title: TrekW - Manager - HR Technology
description:
Manager - HR Technology for a Cleantech platform (Start UP) of a Large Automotive Group


Key Role Expectations

- The position/role is expected to deliver Human Capital Management i.e. E2E HR Support. This includes planning, hands on execution, reviewing, and coordinate, maintenance and enhancement of Human Capital Management (HCM) modules, with an intent to maximize the strategic use of human resources and maintain E2E tech/digital landscape (i.e. Pre-hire to retire and alumni)

- The role is accountable for project deliverables by maintaining project timelines and content, workflows, procedures and quality standards.

- The prospective incumbent in the role is expected bring 3 to 5 years of experience with at least 3 years in HR Tech space. The incumbent is expected to (first hand) know Technology lifecycle, about Tech issues impacting industry, the evolving landscape of HR tech for different services along with good understanding of HR Functional aspect such that it can be delivered via of HR Tech.

- The prospective incumbent in the role will plays a key role in HR Operations, working and collaborating with key stakeholders in support of system maintenance, production support, project/process improvement, training, and managing additional functionality in HR systems.

- The role will ensure exceptional HR systems experience for the company's/organization's employees and managers. Thus, the incumbent should possess the functional, technical, and analytical abilities sufficient for the support

Responsibilities:

- Support in product lifecycle - at all the stages that is Development, deployment and maintenance.

- Assist in test scenarios and test results for all the 3 stages of lifecycle e.g. development, deployment and maintenance.

- Collaborate with HR SME to gather detailed requirements and complete Business Requirements Document (BRD)/SOW.

- Perform application walkthroughs, fit/gap analyses, workshops, business process analyses, specifications, test plans, trouble shooting, acceptance testing and training.

- Create and ensure user friendly accurate process/SOP documentation is designed and updated for all E2E HCM modules and keep it relevant with time.

- Help maintain data integrity in HCM by reviewing and analyzing data and ensure accurate and timely people data is processed to deliver a seamless service.

- Executing test automation scripts on a variety of on-premises and cloud applications.

- Managing for the quality of activities during the release of deliverables to production environment, system test automation requirements, and execution.

- Help in resolving issues that affect application enhancement, schedule, and quality.

- Assisting in enhancements are delivered on time and within budget, and that they meet or exceed expectations.

- Support in Communication Draft and adapting presentations to a wide range of audiences regarding goals, planning process, project initiatives, team innovation, and results.

- Assist/lead the development of integration testing documentation and broaden internal knowledge of HCM through knowledge transfer.

- Maintains awareness of current trends in HR management systems with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies; examines trends in information systems training materials and techniques.

Hiring Specifications:

- The scope of role HR Technology and digitization, which is a strategic function of HR and has an important role in performance driven organization.


Other specifications are:

- MBA in HR or Tech from an institute of repute (Preferred - Bachelor in Tech)

- Around 3 to 6 years of experience in HR, least 3 years in HR or HR Technology.

- Possessing the End User/functional/technical, and analytical abilities sufficient for the support of HCM applications, including experience with workflows.

- Desired skill - process understanding, excel, Planning and forecasting techniques for multiple functional areas, Common HR concepts, & Project management.

- Proficient in MS Office, analytics, and BI reporting

- Good articulation and presentation skills; demonstrated ability to effectively communicate technical and business issues and solutions to multiple organizational levels.

- Proven ability to partner and translate business requirements into system solutions.

- Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward task completion.

- Ability to inspire a team of testers and a passion for testing and test automation; solid experience with automation framework preferred.

title: TrekW - Manager - Reward/Pension & Benefits
description:
Key Role Expectations

- The position is in Reward, Pension and Benefits (RPB) team which is a sub function of HR and responsible for aligning the rewards practices of the organization with the overall HR and organizational philosophy.


- The function is responsible for developing, deploying and updating job descriptions strategy, designing compensation and benefits programs, conducting job analysis & job evaluations, determining an appropriate salary structure, determining long term and short term incentive/bonus plans, establishing salary ranges for each level and grade, managing annual salary revision exercises through surveys, analysis of positioning & budget development, developing a salary administration policy, develop a benefits administration policy, communicating compensation programs to employees and management, monitoring the compensation program and making changes periodically, as necessary. Function also manages and overseas the monthly Payroll process.

- The Manager RPB is responsible to manage for effectively supporting the management facets of Reward, Pension and Benefits. The incumbent in the role participates in developing, planning and implementing new and revised compensation programs, policies and procedures to align with the company's goals and competitive practices.


- This position is also responsible for ensuring that company compensation programs are consistently administered in compliance with internal policies and government regulations via. effective delivery tools like Payroll, HR Tech and Benefits administration

- The prospective incumbent in the role is expected bring 4 to 8 years of experience with at least 3+ years in Reward, Pension and Benefits.


- The incumbent is expected to know about issues impacting industry, very good understanding of science and art of Learning, practical know how of andragogy and learning styles and should be hands on with diagnostics, Instructional Design and training delivery/facilitation (online and offline) and training effectiveness.

Responsibilities:

- Manages the development, implementation, and administration of compensation programs.

- Monitors the effectiveness of existing compensation practices and recommends changes that are cost-effective and consistent with compensation trends and corporate objectives.

- Provides advice to corporate staff on pay decisions, policy interpretations, and job evaluations.

- Designs creative solutions to specific compensation-related programs and incentive plans.

- Develops techniques for compiling, preparing and presenting data.

- Oversees the participation in salary surveys and monitors salary survey data to ensure corporate compensation objectives are achieved.

- Ensures compliance with federal, state and local compensation laws and regulations.

- Bring and continuously add value to the scope by being proficient professional with an extensive knowledge on various processes, tools, systems, procedures within RPB.

- Accountable for project deliverables for the team/self by maintaining workflows, procedures and quality standards

- Manage effective application of existing RPB principles and guides/participates the development of new policies.

Hiring Specifications:

- The scope of role is being intermediate on expertise of RPB, which is a strategic function of HR and has an important role in performance driven organization by enabling the Compensation philosophy and related policies.


Other specifications are:

- MBA in HR from an institute of repute (Preferred - Bachelor Tech/B. Com)

- Around 4 to 8 years of experience in HR, least 4+ years in C&B.

- Articulative and good in building long term relation with stakeholders including Business.

- Knowledge of related Central, state and local regulations and compliance requirements related to employee compensation.

- Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret and communicate data.

- Computer proficiency and technical aptitude with the ability to use Microsoft products, including Excel.

- Strong leadership and team management skills.

- Excellent time management skills and ability to plan and set priorities.

- Strong interpersonal skills in dealing with senior management.

- Competence of the role
