description:
This role shall involve handling the end-to-end Talent acquisition and employee life cycle activities for North and East region comprising of sales, sales enabling and Pan India Operations teams.

This shall be a people manager role with us and as an incumbent to this role, one would manage the following responsibilities:

Talent Acquisition:


- This role is responsible to attract and select the best-in-class talent from our target industry segments - Establish and develop effective working relationships with all stakeholders


- Develop and implement ideas for improving the talent acquisition process and outcomes; identify key sourcing channels; develop and implement creative sourcing strategies, effectively gathering research, making direct contact calls, networking, leveraging relevant social media and employee referrals


- Lead and own the Recruitment cycle which includes working closely with Senior - Leadership, attracting and selecting appropriate talent, salary negotiations and on boarding


- Responsible for effectively communicating the employer brand with potential talent and forging strong partnerships with the HR team, relevant stakeholders and recruiters


- Taking initiatives in organizing recruitment drives and assisting in hiring resources for critical requirements


- Gather and Understand from the external market, best practices to further improve the recruitment process

Business Partnering:


- Align the local people initiatives with global business agenda as well as with cross business agenda within the Region


- Build a robust employee engagement strategy and drive implementation of the same


- Support the design and execution of employee Reward & Recognition initiatives


- Drive timely and fair Performance Management & Assessment


- Development plans for key talent and corrective plans for low performers


- Support the managers in appropriate career management of their team members


- Partner in the process of Policy formation; and ensure implementation and adherence to the policies


- Ensure appropriate documentation to safeguard against legal and reputational risks Roles and Responsibilities

Desired Candidate Profile:

- 7-11 years of relevant full life cycle Talent Acquisition experience, with at least 3-5 years of experience in a team handling role


- Graduate/ Post graduate degree for a Tier 1/ Tier 2 college


- A keen eye for detail and process along with the ability to work in an ever-changing environment


- An ability to find solutions quickly and capability to drive things to closure


- An ability to express unique ideas and concepts in the most creative yet simple manner


- Strong command on language, written as well as spoken


- Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills


- Worked in a fast-paced culture and are high on energy

title: AVP/VP - HR Business Partner - Investment Bank
description:
Company : A Global Investment Bank

Job Title : AVP/VP - HR Business Partner

Experience : 8+ years

Qualification : Full time MBA in HR from a Premium Institute

Job Description : Role responsibilities will encompass all generalist HR functions. This role is primarily responsible for executing HR initiatives for all employees in order to improve performance and build capability and commitment to the Organization

Some specific responsibility areas are to:

1. Partner with Business and be the Strategic Advisor on HR front

2. Work closely with business managers, understanding the business, its needs and leveraging the understanding for HR delivery and guide them to resolve HR issues

3. Communicate and reinforce the value proposition to employees through each connect point

4. Help managers to create Career Development opportunities by sharing employee aspirations and needs for respective Business Units

5. Drive HR Processes like Compensation, Performance Appraisal (Goal Setting / MYR / YE review), Talent Management and Advancement for respective Business Units

6. Help Recruitment team in the hiring Process for respective Business Units

7. Provide HR intelligence about competitors through various available sources and help business to act proactively for talent retention initiatives

8. Drive employee engagement initiatives for the business unit.

9. Provide clarity across the division to all employees by effective cascading of HR policies & practices

10. Chip in for Employee Relations cases: Warning, Compliance Breach, Harassment, Grievance, etc., liaison with legal, compliance and Head - Employee Relations to influence closures on such cases

11. Drive Training & Development in the Business Unit by understanding and identifying the training needs and leverage the expertise of L&D team for various initiatives and team building exercises.

12. Prepare and analyze data to provide key analytics that aid decision making

Desired Candidate Profile :

1. Full time MBA/PG in HR, with around 8+ years' experience in the Human Resource function

2. Should have generalist HR experience preferably in MNC organizations (With a good exposure to HR practices) with strong exposure to interaction with senior leadership & stakeholder management

title: AVP/Manager - Compensation/Benefits & Rewards - Investment Bank
description:
About the Company: A Global Investment Bank with offices in 30 countries

Business Unit Overview:

The Human Resources team partners with businesses to offer a consistent global approach to people management with local ownership and delivery. Its objective is to support company's Vision and Values making it a vibrant and exciting place to work for, to attract and retain the best people and be recognized as an employer of choice.

Title: Manager / Assistant Vice President

Experience: 6 - 12 years

Purpose of the role:

To create a truly human workplace by building and supporting Total Rewards function - where people feel supported and know they are constantly growing and learning every day. Integrate holistic wellbeing of each employee into the larger business strategy. Develop and demonstrate good knowledge of Total Rewards function (Compensation, Benefits & Wellness)

Compensation:

1. Support the overall planning and execution of Year End (YE) Compensation exercise

2. Provide YE reporting support & data management through the year

3. Provide support for Compensation projects across India

4. Provide Market Intelligence through different resources like secondary research, networking with compensation professionals in other peer firms

5. Other BAU activities in Compensation Department including reporting, resolving HRBP queries etc.

Benefits & Wellness:

1. Planning and executing employee benefits and wellness initiatives

2. Work with internal & external stakeholders to execute the initiatives as per calendar

3. Translate proposed initiatives in physical, mental, social, financial wellbeing into executable programs, annual priorities and targets

4. Be accountable for measuring and tracking impact and effectiveness of the Benefits and Wellness programs

5. Relationship management with the vendor and monitor performance

6. Adhoc projects to enhance employee experience related to Total Rewards

Desired Profile:

1. Post Graduate with 4-8 years of experience in C & B

title: Senior Manager - Talent & Organizational Development - Aviation/Constructions/FMCG
description:
Senior Manager, Talent and Organizational Development


Job Role:

- The Senior Manager, Talent and Organizational Development - India position leads GIA India Pvt. Laboratory's India Center of Excellence with focus areas that include talent management, succession planning, employee engagement, leadership development, change management, culture, and continuous learning to include inclusion and diversity.


- Additionally the role holder is expected to consult and collaborate with leaders, HR business partners, and employees across the organisation to develop, implement, sustain, and improve enterprise programmes that meet the organization's current and future needs

Essential Duties:

- Is accountable for strategizing, creating, designing, and managing GIA India's Talent Development, Learning, Leadership Capability Building, and Organizational Development organization interventions, programs, and frameworks.

- Works closely with Top Leaders, Director HR and Admin, India, Global CoE, HRBPs, and other key stakeholders to shape and co-create offerings that help the organization to achieve its overall strategic objectives and business needs.

- Develops holistic solutions by utilising a variety of processes, techniques, and tools, such as diagnosis, assessments, learning journey design, coaching, and other strategic talent investments.

- Takes a proactive role in change communication, and culture development

- Responsible for consultant and vendor selection, management and contract administration associated with the support of the L&OD team goals.

- Utilizes metrics that will identify key business effectiveness, results and return-on-investment (ROI) of organizational development initiatives.

- Collaborates with leaders of organizational change efforts to align and leverage all change initiatives throughout the organization, using common models and processes.

- Leads a team of direct and indirect resources to accomplish goals.

- Exceptional interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills, including the ability to relate to and influence staff at all levels.

- Encourages, motivates, negotiates effectively, and maintains highly effective relationships externally and internally. Strong writing skills, including the ability to synthesize information into clear, concise messages both for detailed analytical reports and executive summaries.

- Solid sense of confidentiality and discretion.

- Ability to work independently, work with a remote team, think creatively, manage own time, and take initiative to drive projects; manage client relationships.

- Experience working in a global environment and ability to travel within India and Internationally as required

- Support with Learning and Development Audits and Implementation of Action Items

Knowledge:

- Leadership Development

- Learning Diagnostics and Design

- Instructional Design and Content Development using Adult Learning Principles, and leveraging Blended Learning

- OD Processes

- Working Knowledge of Assessment and Development Centers (ADC), and Psychometrics

- Competency Frameworks

- Talent Management - IDPs, 9 Box, etc.

- Domain expertise, and awareness of trends and the future of Talent and OD

- LnOD Operations and Management

- Working Knowledge of Competency Frameworks, including behavioural indicators and BARS

Skills:

- Proven expertise in aligning learning strategy to business needs

- Excellent Interpersonal and communication skills

- Stakeholder Management

- Collaborative Team player and relationship manager who can work closely with Business Leaders and other key stakeholders

- Facilitation

- Ability to work with initiative

- Experience in working with a multi-cultural and multinational environment , and managing global stakeholders

- Learning Agility

Ability:

- Ability to anticipate and respond to business situations effectively with creative solutions

- Ability to gain consensus and build alignment with stakeholders

- Excellent problem solving and trouble-shooting ability

- Deep listening and internal customer centricity

- Ability to lead a team.

title: Vice President/Global Head - Talent Acquisition - BPO/ITeS
description:
- Recruitment & Selection strategy, manpower planning for the organization across geographies.


- Robust experience to visualize organization needs in terms of manpower and should be able to optimize cost by strategize hiring split into campus, contractual, retainer and lateral without compromising on quality


- Lead, manage, mentor, empower and guide the talent acquisition team across geographies


- Ensure recruitment policies and procedures are continuously improved and meet the business requirements incorporating the best recruitment practices of industry and be among the leaders.


- Build diverse sourcing strategy with vendor network and alternated modes of hiring like recruitment process outsourcing, alternate profiles, contractual staffing and leveraging gig workforce. Uses alternative sourcing strategies including direct sourcing and social media.


- Ensure compliance and due diligence for Recruitment partners/consultant selection and onboarding and review rigout to measure their performance.


- Responsible for managing and maintaining key recruitment metrices and present them at defined frequency to all stake holders.


- Seeks to listen, to understand the business needs and consistently driving high levels of service and delivery, nurturing stake holder relationship and partnering with them for forecasting and manpower planning


- Ensuring comprehensive candidate communication consistent with the organization culture, vision, projects, capabilities, strategic focus, development opportunities and compensation and benefits.


- Constantly evaluate and improve candidate experience at all stages of recruitment process.


- Manage cost containment and cost savings initiatives impacting recruitment contracts, agencies, and consultants.


- Bring in automation to make hiring a seamless experience for candidates and business. Utilizes applicant tracking system, job boards, niche sites and recruiting process for proper tracking of recruiting metrics.


- Work with the marketing team to create employer branding for Organisation.

Campus Relations - Devise & implement campus hiring strategy & build effective relationships across target colleges - Ensure hiring of Trainees to build talent pipeline - Own onboarding program for Interns and trainees

Key Performance Indicators :


- Timely delivery vis - a - vis manpower plans


- Quality of deliverables


- Hiring TATs


- Hiring cost


- Hiring source mix


- Campus engagement scores/ metrics


- Social media engagement


- Compliance (BGV/ employee files)


- Success of various initiatives within pre -defined quality parameters


- Customer centricity

What you'll bring to the team:


- Overall 15 - 17 years of recruitment experience


- Preference of at least 5- 7 years of Technology hiring


- Good knowledge of sourcing tools and technologies including social media platforms


- Experience of working in a fast-moving environment with a strong focus on delivery


- Hands-on knowledge of HR processes and recruitments to have an efficient recruitment system


- Skills in planning and delivering initiatives that improve business results in a demanding environment


- Strong influencing skills and an ability to operate at a higher level


- Good communication and networking skills


- Strong exposure to global business environments/ global roles/ senior stakeholders


- Strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to challenge thinking and influence change


- Self-driven, result-oriented structured approach


- Strategic thought leadership in designing future state delivery and strategies for attaining them


- A collaborative approach, ability to work across organizational lines

title: Sagana - Chief Human Resources Officer
description:
Butterfly Learnings ( www.butterflylearnings.com) is one of India's most exciting new companies in the pediatric behavioral therapy space, committed to guiding our children to grow into happy childhoods.

Established by professional physicians and a key team of professional developmental Paediatricians and Behavioural Therapists in 2021, we have grown considerably into 30+ centers, with plans to grow exponentially into 12 states as well as establish overseas centers as well within the next two years

Supporting this business expansion, at its core is the Human Resources function and the Chief Human Resources Officer and their team of HR professionals.

Overview :

- As the Head of Human Resources & Development, you will have an integral part in developing and implementing HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.

- You will work closely with the Founders to develop and implement exciting and innovative people strategies, establish a culture that will be the envy of the industry, develop best-in-class practices, and engage continuously with educational institutions, psychologists, and educationalists within Butterfly as well as outside.

- The CHRO will work to bridge and synergize management and employee aspirations and take Butterfly Learnings to its rightful place as one of the most exciting companies globally.

- You will support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital.

Key Responsibilities :

1) Work closely and intensely with senior management to understand and partner with the organization's long-term and short-term goals and workforce needs. Bring analytical skills by developing unique HR data sets and patterns to the attention of Management.

2) Build and continuously reinforce the unique culture and social commitment of Butterfly Learnings through policies, actions, and personal example

3) Develop new and exciting, best-in-class HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization.

4) Create and implement employee relations policies to help increase employees' job satisfaction

5) Implement global best practices to streamline and enhance the lifecycle of every employee

6) Continuously communicate with employees about compensation, benefits, and other facets of their employment

7) Proactively address all queries or potential grievances and complaints from employees in a timely fashion

8) Upskill and engage with all other HR department personnel as well as other Management personnel

9) Supports management by providing human resources advice, counsel, and decisions.

10) Compliance with central, state, and local legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation.

11) Build a solid pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future staffing needs by creating significant talent pipelines from educational institutions, employee referral schemes, and other strategies

12) Conduct periodic and proactive Talent mapping and market analysis to stay ahead of industry trends.

13) Maintain good partnerships with talent managers and department heads to proactively understand their staffing needs and requirements.

14) Develop and promote the employer brand to attract key talent.

15) Implement initiatives to enhance the organization's reputation as an employer of choice.

16) Support and leverage online platforms to showcase the company culture and values.

Qualifications:

- Master's degree in human resources or related field

- About 10+ years' experience in the human resources department, with 3+ years' experience in an HR leadership position, especially in the medical sector

- Deep understanding of the interviewing process, benefits administration, payroll, and other HR functions

- Advanced analytical, communication, leadership, and planning skills

- Candidates who are women and have experience medical sector are encouraged to apply.

Location: Thane

Join our team and contribute to shaping a creative and diverse workforce that supports our organization's values and growth!

title: Senior Manager - Human Resources - Manufacturing Firm
description:
Plant HR Exposure is a must-have

The HR Business Partner acts as a part of the connected team of HR resources that are embedded within the business, providing advisory support as it relates to workforce and strategic talent planning, HR program development, and the implementation of HR initiatives.

This position is expected to deliver on driving the Manufacturing, Quality and Agriculture organization's end- to end agenda around the best-in-class execution strategy with deep focus on employee experience, operational excellence, and continuous improvement to drive sustainable business results.

Roles and Responsibilities & Key Deliverables

- Business Partnership

- Change Management

- Organization Design

- Performance Management

- Engagement & Culture Champion

- Talent Management

- Training & Development

Other Priorities:

- Compile workforce analytics to develop people insights, sharing with Sr. HR Business Partner(s) and Regional VP, HR

- Provide input for quarterly and annual business planning, and outlines resourcing and "people" implications / considerations

- Supports people leaders within client group to develop effective management and leadership behaviours, giving people leaders the tools to succeed as managers / leaders

- Provide input to CoEs to define and implement forward-thinking workforce strategies and solutions to meet business environment needs

- Gather requirements to help with the development of HR programs, processes, and policies for a specific business unit based on business needs

- Support change execution, supporting client group in understanding and embracing changes

The role will report to Director - HR & Administration and will have a team size of 3.

Qualifications :

- MBA / Equivalent- Human Resource

- 10+ years. Experience in HR.

- Experience of supporting sales organization is an added advantage and necessary. Added experience of leadership development, Culture building, OD, DEI is a plus

title: Senior Manager - HR Business Partner - Plant
description:
Sr Manager HRBP Plant


Primary Purpose of Role:

- The HRBPs at the organisation look at the business goals, draws on their knowledge of HR, and develops strategies (action plans) to assist the business in delivering those goals.

- The HR Business Partner acts as a part of the connected team of HR resources that are embedded within the business, providing advisory support as it relates to workforce and strategic talent planning, HR program development, and the implementation of HR initiatives.

- This position is expected to deliver on driving the Manufacturing, Quality and Agriculture organization's end-to end agenda around the best-in-class execution strategy with deep focus on employee experience,operational excellence, and continuous improvement to drive sustainable business results.

Roles and Responsibilities & Key Deliverables:

Business Partnership:

- Provide consultation related to workforce and resource planning, performance management, change management delivery, and employee & labour relations within the targeted client group

- Influence the business by developing solutions and proactively gaining opinions.

- Apply local market knowledge to develop fact based recommendations to drive business

- Interpret HR and business challenges to develop appropriate HR responses

- Deliver results with integrity and apply the appropriate risk framework

- Influence and coach Leaders on all aspects of employee relations

- Develop and implement local policies reflecting regulatory requirements

- Driving innovative methods of engagement.

Change Management:

- Conduct impact analysis and assess change readiness, including identifying training needs with reference all changes occur in the businesses.

- Engage with stakeholders to align change management to action plan

- Ensure cross-functional teams are aware and engaged in the change

- Apply appropriate change management methodology, executive plan and follow-up on impact

- Evaluate effectiveness and course correct as needed

Organization Design:

- Identify organizational design opportunities, including new ways of working, to drive organizational effectiveness solutions to the client group

- Apply different types of organizational design Create appropriate timelines and action steps to meet targets

- Communicate findings and present recommendations to key stakeholders

Performance Management:

- Drive implementation of performance management activities at the business level to ensure Adherence with organization wide guidelines.

- Drive quarterly reviews and lead year-end calibrations and annual merit discussions with Business Leaders.

- Drive the Performance Improvement Plans for low performers

- Ensure HR Programmes designed are enabling a high performance culture

Engagement & Culture Champion:

- Partner with business leaders to establish engagement strategies

- Coach and Train the people managers to develop action plans.

- Collaborate with managers in execution of action plan. Publish dash boards to build accountability among managers.

- Drive communication around the engagement survey at various phases.

Talent Management:

- Implement Talent Management processes for the client group to ensure continuous identification, development and retention of high potential talent.

- Work with line managers on the design and delivery of appropriate and relevant IDPs for their employees

- Facilitate IJPs, Promotions and Job Rotations by developing and executing Assessment Centers across functions.

- Use Talent strategies to proactively Map talents to minimize loss of business days for MCRs

Training & Development:

- Drive the organizational development agenda; ensure delivery of comprehensive learning & development programs through effective utilization of available learning programs as well as identifying new opportunities for building learning content.

- Build capability - Partner with functions for design and execution of functional trainings, ensure delivery to last mile employee. Drive Success Frameworks and enabling employees to develop functional mastery.

- Develop leadership capability through coaching and mentoring; support employee development and achievement of IDPs. Drive implementation of competency framework and 360-degree feedback process.

- Lead Talent / skill development for first time managers & enabling supervisors to be effective people Managers.

- Develop Annual Training Calendar basis TNA. Managing annual training budget.

- Facilitator for Training Sessions

Other Priorities:

- Compile workforce analytics to develop people insights, sharing with Sr. HR Business Partner(s)and Regional VP, HR

- Provide input for quarterly and annual business planning, and outlines resourcing and "people" implications / considerations

- Supports McCain people leaders within client group to develop effective management and leadership behaviours, giving people leaders the tools to succeed as managers / leaders

- Provide input to CoEs to define and implement forward-thinking workforce strategies and solutions to meet business environment needs

- Support regional implementation of CoE-driven processes, policies and initiatives

- Gather requirements to help with the development of HR programs, processes, and policies fora specific business unit based on business needs

- Support change execution, supporting client group in understanding and embracing changes

- Refer employees to the Employee Experience Centre or the appropriate service channel to resolve inquiries / transaction request and provides self service coaching, as appropriate.

Measures of success:

- Talent Management - Succession coverage; Retention of HiPo/

- Diversity

- Organizational Development - development plans in SF; client requirement fulfillment

- Employee engagement

- Safety

- Budget (direct / indirect) management

Knowledge/Experience:

- 10 + years of HR Business Partner experience in a manufacturing organization

- Master's degree in Human Resources or a related field

- Ability to apply HR knowledge / experience across all HR policies, programs, processes, andfunctions

- Ability to understand HR compliance requirements

- Strong internal consulting skills, with working ability to influence change

- Strong business-specific knowledge and organizational behavior / design / effectiveness skills

- Ability to facilitate relationships and partner with business leaders

- Strong business acumen and project management skills

- Working knowledge of talent management lifecycle

- Expert knowledge of local employment-related laws and regulations

- Strong communication and facilitation skills

- Ability to translate business requirements into workable solutions

- Shared accountability for region/location performance and culture

description:

The HRBP, will work with leadership, senior management team to develop, implement and drive results increasing organizational effectiveness and efficiency. title: Cafe Coffee Day -  Human Resources Analyst
description:
Responsibilities:


Data Collection and Management:


- Collect and organize HR data from various sources, such as employee databases, performance reviews, surveys, and other relevant systems.


- Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency to create a reliable database for analysis.


Data Analysis:


- Utilize statistical techniques and tools to analyze HR data and extract meaningful insights.


- Identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data to provide valuable information for decision-

making.


Predictive Analytics:


- Use predictive modeling techniques to forecast future trends related to workforce planning, employee

turnover, and other HR-related metrics.


- Provide insights to help HR and organizational leaders make proactive decisions.


Benchmarking:


- Compare HR metrics and performance against industry benchmarks and best practices.


- Identify areas of improvement and recommend strategies to enhance HR effectiveness.


Reporting and Visualization:


Develop and generate regular reports on key HR metrics for stakeholders and ad hoc reports on HR

metrics. Use data visualization tools to create dashboards that present complex HR data in an

understandable and actionable format.


Workforce Planning:


Assist in workforce planning by analyzing current and future staffing needs based on organizational

goals. Provide insights into talent gaps and help develop strategies for recruitment, training, and

development.


Employee Engagement and Retention:


- Analyze data to assess employee engagement levels and identify factors influencing retention.


- Recommend strategies to improve employee satisfaction, productivity, and retention.


Compliance and Risk Management:


- Monitor HR data for compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.


- Identify and address potential risks related to HR practices and policies.


System Administration:


- Oversee the administration and configuration of HR information systems.


- Troubleshoot system issues and collaborate with IT to implement solutions.


- Stay updated on system upgrades and enhancements.


- Collaborate with HR business partners and leaders to understand their analytical needs and provide

timely and accurate reports and analysis Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to

forecast workforce trends and support strategic workforce planning initiatives


Qualifications:


- Degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, or a related


- 2 to 3 years , 1+ Years - experience in FMCG/Retail chains


- Strong analytical and problem solving skills.


- Proficiency in HRIS software and tools.


- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


- Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy


- Experience in MS Office, Excel, PPT, Outlook

title: Aon - Senior Consultant/Manager - HR M&A
description:
Job Title - Senior Consultant/Consulting Manager - HR M&A (Based on fitment)

Location - Gurgaon

Role - Client Facing

Work Mode - In Office

Education :

- Full Time MBA/PGDM in Human Resource from Tier 1/Tier 2 B School.

- Work Experience - 1 - 5 years of relevant post qualification experience.

Experience : Strong experience across HR M&A, Post Merger Integration, HR Due Diligence, Compensation & Rewards Benchmarking, Organization Design and Transformation, PMS design, Competency Design projects etc.

About AON Talent Solutions

Aon's Talent Solutions is one of the largest full spectrum HR consulting practices and is home to firm's rewards, talent assessment, and performance & analytics practices. We apply this expertise, and our market-leading workforce data, to help clients tackle transformational projects requiring integrated solutions to client problems. We develop insights on performance and people analytics - driven by our proprietary data, technology and advisory services - to help clients reduce volatility and improve outcomes.

We have more than 300 consultants serving India market helping clients with their most complex challenging problems using deep insights and analytics. We are trusted advisors for wide variety of organizations including BSE500 and work with largest set of early-stage technology organizations in the country.

Role Purpose : The objective of this role is to support market and client development across M&A workstream under Future Solutions Group across ISC. This role will also be involved in delivery of client projects in the M&A solution areas viz. HR Due Diligence, post-merger integration and HR PMO.

Role Responsibilities : This is a multi-pronged role with responsibilities stretching in various dimensions, both in terms of industries and solution areas. It lays an equivalent focus on both market development and project delivery.

Key responsibilities are :

- Support business development activities related to M&A pitches viz. lead generation, proposal creation, client negotiation, etc. for solutions offered by the team

- Deliver M&A projects in the HR due diligence, post-merger integration and HR PMO, while working closely with all Practices

- Drive the market development of M&A solution area across industries with special focus on Technology, Pharmaceuticals and FI. Formulate and implement a strategy to achieve the same.

Key Result Areas :

- Implementation of M&A market development strategy

- Generation and conversion of business leads for M&A solutions

- C-SAT on client projects

- EOPR scores

- Support provided in achievement of revenue targets in the following areas:

a. HR Due Diligence

b. Post-merger integration

c. HR PMO

Empowerment:

The role provides a high degree of empowerment to the incumbent. It gives the opportunity to bring in one's own ideas and implement the same. This role provides a huge canvas for incumbents who have an entrepreneurial streak and can take initiative.

Key Skills and Competencies:

- Entrepreneurial skills

- Initiative

- Ownership and accountability

- Interpersonal and liaising skills

- Blue-sky thinking

- Implementation focus

- Achievement orientation

Key Interactions:

Internal:

a. Cross-Practice - Performance, Rewards and Organization

b. Aon colleagues

c. M&A global colleagues

- External

a. Clients, both corporate clients and private equity/ venture capital firms

Geographical spread: The role will cater to India and other South Asia geographies.

HRBP - Tech - Automotive Manufacturing Company


Human Resource Business Partner : Tech

Job Summary:

As the HR Lead for the Global Technology organization, the incumbent holds a pivotal role in ensuring the delivery of HR functions with a focus on Employee Engagement/Advocacy, Employee Relations, Performance Management, Career Development/Coaching, Talent Assessment, Acquisition, and Retention. Collaborating closely with the leadership team, this role contributes to the development and execution of human resource and talent strategies, emphasizing aspects such as recruiting, retention, and succession planning.

- Collaborative decision-making ability.

- Highly motivated self-starter with a strong result orientation and change management skills.

- Quick rapport building and relationship development across all organizational levels.

- Advocacy for employees with an approachable demeanor.

title: Lead/Manager - IT Talent Hiring
description:
IT Talent Hiring Lead /Manager


- We are looking for an ambitious and self-driven Talent Acquisition Manager to join our team! As a TA Manager, you will be responsible for finding, recruiting, hiring and retaining talented candidates.

- You'll be in charge of planning, developing and implementing a new and productive Talent Acquisition strategy for our company.

Talent Acquisition Manager duties and responsibilities :

Talent Acquisition (TA) Manager job description should contain the following duties and responsibilities:

- Investigate and determine employee needs

- Develop a sustainable talent acquisition and hiring plans and strategies

- Design, plan and execute employer branding activities

- Encourage employees to be brand ambassadors

- Plan employee referral programs

- Use HRIS, Recruitment Marketing tools

- Source and find candidates qualified for open positions

- perform analysis of hiring needs and provide employee hiring forecast

- Design, plan and execute selection processes (conduct interviews and screening calls, administer psychological tests etc.)

- Reviews employment applications and background check reports

- Find bottlenecks in the recruiting process

- Perform candidate and employee satisfaction evaluations and workshops

- Plan procedures for improving the candidate experience

- Suggest measures for improving employee retention

- Lead, oversee and supervise members of the recruiting team

- Use sourcing methods for hard-to-fill roles

- Attend career and college fairs, and similar events

- Determine HR and recruiting KPIs

- Create and present KPI reports

Talent Acquisition Manager qualifications and requirements :

Talent Acquisition (TA) Manager job description should contain the following requirements and qualifications:

- 4+ years of experience as TA Manager or similar HR role

- In-depth knowledge of full-cycle recruiting and employer branding techniques

- Familiarity with a variety of different selection methods (interviews, assignments, psychological test etc.)

- Hands on experience with posting jobs on social media and job boards

- Experience with HRIS, ATS, Sourcing and Recruitment Marketing tools

- Ability to motivate employees

- A sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company's success

- Critical thinker and problem-solving skills

- Team player

- Good time-management skills

- Great interpersonal and communication skills

- MA/PG in human resources, business administration or similar relevant field

- Strong knowledge of Human Resources law.

title: Senior Director - Human Resource Development - Technology
description:
Job Overview : As a Human Resources Director (HRD), you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our human resources functions. You will play a crucial role in developing and implementing HR strategies, policies, and programs to support the organization's goals. The HRD will lead a team of HR professionals and collaborate with other departments to ensure a positive and productive working environment.


Key Responsibilities :


- Strategic HR Leadership: Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with organizational objectives. Provide strategic guidance on workforce planning, talent acquisition, and employee development.


- Policy Development and Compliance: Establish and enforce HR policies and procedures in compliance with relevant labor laws and regulations. Regularly review and update HR policies to reflect best practices and legal requirements.


- Talent Acquisition and Retention: Lead recruitment efforts to attract and retain top talent. Develop and implement employee retention programs to foster a positive workplace culture.


- Employee Relations: Handle employee relations issues, investigations, and conflict resolution. Ensure fair and consistent application of HR policies across the organization.


- Performance Management: Oversee performance management processes, including goal setting, performance reviews, and employee development plans. Work with leadership to identify and address performance gaps.


- Training and Development: Implement training and development programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge. Identify and address skill gaps within the organization.


- Benefits Administration: Manage employee benefits programs, ensuring competitive and attractive offerings. Stay informed about industry trends and recommend adjustments to benefits packages.


- HR Metrics and Reporting: Develop and analyze HR metrics to measure the effectiveness of HR programs. Provide regular reports to senior management on key HR indicators.


Qualifications:


- Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.


- Master's degree preferred.


- Proven experience as an HR Director or in a senior HR leadership role.


- In-depth knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and best practices.


- Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.


- Excellent communication and negotiation abilities.


- Demonstrated ability to drive HR initiatives that support business objectives.

title: JP Morgan Chase - Associate - Employee Relations
description:
The Employee Relations team is part of the Total Rewards, Conduct and Policy organization within HR that focuses on enhancing the employee experience and developing best in class people practices firm wide. The team helps set and implement a global vision, strategy, operating model to better understand and respond to employee needs and concerns; as well deliver exceptional employee experience. This includes partnership with the business, function, and HR leaders on an in-depth review of feedback, culture & conduct, employee experience aspects of regulatory-related deliverables. Overall, this organization spans the traditional HR lifecycle, employee engagement and broader listening strategy.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Part of a team of experienced Employee Relations (ER) professionals responsible for providing employee relations advice and investigating code of conduct related matters inclusive of harassment, discrimination, retaliation, workplace violence, inappropriate behavior and executive office complaints ensuring proper escalation, engagement and fairness is delivered across all stakeholder groups;

- Responsible for reaching HR disciplinary outcomes for assigned employee conduct investigations, including investigations led by Control Partners and Employee Relations;

- Ensure the enquiry and investigation reports meet the highest quality standards and adherence to case management timelines and system requirements;

- Support Employee Relations leadership on implementing key country-wide projects around conduct, governance, policy and control;

- Partner with Employee Relations leadership in analyzing and providing insights to senior leaders and HR stakeholders on areas of focus and emerging trends, to enable proactive interventions within the organization;

- Partner with ER leadership, as appropriate, globally to understand regional differences and requirements;

- Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and refinement of services;

- Demonstrate expected behaviors, as well as, identify and escalate issues in a timely manner;

- Deliver a trusted ER brand known to employees and managers as a place where their voices are heard and acted on accordingly;

- Deliver a first class experience to all employees, stakeholders and control partners through effective collaboration and communication;

- Participate in various risk and control initiative, including assisting with regulatory responses on employee conduct matters;

- As an when engaged, conduct and participate in the ER aspects of organizational audits, transactions and RFPs.

SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS:

- Working knowledge or experience in matters related to unsatisfactory performance, unauthorized leaves, redundancy management, background screening and other HR policy violations;

- Demonstrated success in building strong relationships and trusted advisor status across Legal, Compliance, Global Security, and with Human Resources colleagues;

- Knowledge of ER practices, procedures, and policies;

- Impeccable judgment and discretion;

- Excel operationally and have a laser focus on key stakeholder experience - employees, managers, partners;

- Actively challenges the status quo and acts as a catalyst for change by decisively adopting innovative ways of working, driving continuous improvement;

- Identifies and understands business trends to improve culture and mitigate risk;

- Strong written and verbal communication skills;

- Strong time management and multi-tasking abilities;

- Disciplined and drives for results; actively applies feedback from key stakeholders;

- Strong consulting/problem resolution experience with demonstrated ability to influence all employee levels from front line to senior leaders;

- Demonstrates expected risk/controls behaviors by holding self and others accountable to operate within established standards and procedures;

Preferable skills include proficiency in Microsoft Office suite

description:

title: Head - Learning & Development/Consulting - Education
description:
Who we are: Athena is India's largest institution in the premium undergraduate study abroad space. Founded 10 years ago by two Princeton graduates, Poshak Agrawal and Rahul Subramaniam, Athena is headquartered in Gurgaon, with offices in Mumbai and Bangalore, and caters to students from over 15 countries.

Athena's vision is to help students become the best version of themselves. Athena's transformative, holistic life coaching program embraces both depth and breadth, sciences and the humanities. Athena encourages students to deepen their theoretical knowledge and apply it to address practical issues confronting society, both locally and globally.

Through our flagship program, our students have gotten into various universities including Harvard University, Princeton University, Yale University, Stanford University, University of Cambridge, MIT, Brown, Cornell University, University of Pennsylvania, University of Chicago, among others.

Our legacy as pioneers in the study-abroad process, coupled with a creative, open environment and professional growth opportunities, makes Athena a perfect place for those looking to build a lasting career in education.

If you are excited to work in a dynamic educational environment and love expanding your horizons of emotional and strategic counseling, we look forward to hearing from you!

Learn more about Athena:

https://www.athenaeducation.co.in/article.aspx

Summary of the role :

- The Head-Consulting is responsible for the consulting programs and policies of Athena Education - heading the consulting department. The Head- Consulting will work closely with the founders to develop and implement a strategic vision for Athena Education that will ensure that the organization remains at the forefront of educational innovation. The Head- Consulting will also be responsible for ensuring that the delivery of our consulting services meets the highest standards of quality and is aligned with the organization's mission and goals.

- If you have an entrepreneurial, visionary, and action-oriented individual who is passionate about working in the education space, in a high-velocity, dynamic environment, this job is for you! We also hope you embrace a liberal arts mindset and demonstrate the ability to inspire, lead, and collaborate with Department Heads of diverse fields.

Key Responsibilities :

Collaborative Leadership and Organisational Growth :

- Collaborate with the co-founders to develop a comprehensive strategic vision for Athena Education's consulting services.

- Work collaboratively with department heads to develop and implement innovative strategies.

- Support the founder's and management with the development and execution of business growth plans.

- Focus on scaling capabilities, capacity, systems, and processes

- Ensure the organization's positioning at the forefront of educational innovation in India

Process Improvement and Enhancement :

- Play a pivotal role in shaping and optimizing the overall operations of the consulting

- Foster a culture of consulting excellence within the organization.

- Drive process improvements in parent engagement and scholar success.

- Conduct regular evaluation and assessment of programs, policies, KPIs, and team performance.

- Drive continuous improvement initiatives. Incorporate new ideas and best practices into academic programs and policies.

- Stay informed about changes in the study abroad landscape, educational policies, and industry best practices

Client Management and Customer Satisfaction :

- Manage escalations and provide direction to SCMs (Sr Consulting Managers).

- Serve as the de-facto owner of client relationships and satisfaction.

- Establish a robust mechanism for collecting and analyzing customer feedback.

- Use customer insights to drive continuous improvement in consulting services and overall client satisfaction.

Client Outreach and Expansion :

- Contribute to the expansion of Athena Education's footprint by exploring new markets and opportunities.

- Collaborate with business development teams to identify and pursue growth opportunities.

Strategic Partnerships :

- Identify and cultivate strategic partnerships with educational institutions, industry associations, and other key stakeholders.

- Collaborate with partners to enhance the range and quality of services offered by Athena Education.

Team Management and Team Coaching :

- Recruit, train, and develop a team of skilled consultants.

- Provide leadership and mentorship to a team of consultants, fostering an environment of collaboration, innovation and excellence

- Drive the professional development of team members, ensuring their skills and knowledge align with the evolving needs of the education sector.

- Oversee the consulting team's operations ensuring efficiency and excellence in client delivery, client communication and management

- Manage and oversee the consulting function in our satellite offices in Mumbai and Bangalore.

- Ensure alignment of satellite offices with the overall strategic vision and goals of Athena Education.

Education and Experience Required :

- Education from an elite university in India or abroad.

- Mandatory 10+ years of experience in consulting or professional services. Experience in the study abroad application process is essential.

- Proven ability to lead and manage a high stakes team of young professionals.

- Ability to work independently and as part of a team and in ambiguous situations.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills is a must.

- Previous role as the de-facto owner of client relationships/satisfaction.

Why should you be interested?

Impact :

- Working with Athena will provide you with an opportunity to bring about a positive impact in the lives of the best students in the country - the future pioneers of the world.

Team and Culture :


- We are a young and daring collection of adventurers dedicated to excellence and growth. We are always efficient and occasionally funny.

- The candidate will get a chance to work in a multicultural environment with ex-pats from different corners of the globe.

Professional Advancement :

- We give every opportunity to our team members to grow holistically: grow in their field of interest, and become leaders at early stages of their career.We also offer the opportunity to collaborate across our group organizations - Hora.ai (Tech) and Sitare Foundation (education non-profit)- and learn from like-minded, passionate people who have all come together to create an impact.

Location & Work Environment

- The Vatika Triangle; Gurgaon, India

- We have built a creative space in a top corporate building in Gurgaon. The office is on M.G. Road, a 2-minute walk from the M.G. Road Metro Station.

- This role may involve travel to the Mumbai and Bangalore offices.

- Our team comprises creative and diverse people, all goal-oriented, proactive, and looking to transform students' lives. We love to work hard, play hard! Our work environment encourages you to be an independent thinker, an intellectually curious team member, and be an objective decision maker. To top it all, we love to share food! :)

Benefits :

- Competitive salary and benefits package which includes health insurance, gym and mental health support, etc.

title: Kotak Life Insurance - DVP/Lead - Performance & Rewards
description:
Objective of the Role:

The Performance and Reward lead is responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of Performance and Reward management within an organization. This role requires a deep understanding of compensation & reward strategies, performance evaluation methods, and the ability to align these functions with the company's overall business objectives. The Performance and Reward lead plays a crucial role in attracting, retaining, and motivating employees while ensuring that their performance contributes to the company's success

Key Responsibilities:

- Develop, implement, and continuously refine the organization's compensation strategy to attract and retain top talent.

- Analyze industry trends, benchmarking data, and market conditions to ensure competitive compensation packages.

- Ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations related to compensation

- Designing and Managing all aspects of compensation planning, including salary structures, bonuses, incentives, and equity programs, pay for performance.

- Conduct regular compensation reviews to maintain fairness and equity within the organization.

- Assist in the evaluation and classification of jobs within the organization to ensure internal equity.

- Review job descriptions to determine appropriate salary ranges and job classifications.

- Provide guidance to HR and managers on salary-related matters, including salary offers, promotions, and adjustments.

- Participate in salary surveys to gather external market data and ensure the organization's compensation practices remain competitive.

- Design, develop, implement and oversee the performance management framework, including performance appraisal processes, goal setting, performance evaluations feedback mechanisms and performance improvement plans.

- Collaborate with department heads and managers to establish clear, measurable, and achievable performance objectives for employees.

- Ensure that individual and team goals are aligned with the organization's strategic goals and objectives.

- Provide guidance and training to managers and employees on performance management best practices.

- Collaborate with HR and communication teams to ensure clear and effective communication of compensation and performance-related information to employees.

- Work with HR and department heads to identify training and development opportunities for employees to improve their performance and career growth.

- Foster a culture of transparency and fairness in compensation and performance practices.

- Implement succession planning strategies to ensure a strong pipeline of talent.

- Stay up-to-date with changes in employment laws and regulations to ensure compliance.

- Develop and manage the compensation and performance management budgets. Monitor expenses and optimize resources to achieve departmental goals.

- Collaborate with HR and finance teams to ensure accurate and timely payroll processing.

Education: Post Graduate

Work experience in years :

- A minimum of 10-15 years of experience in compensation and performance management.

- In-depth knowledge of compensation principles, performance management best practices, and relevant employment laws.

- Expert knowledge in Excel, PowerPoint (making and delivering presentations)

- Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with various stakeholders.

- Proficiency in HRIS (Human Resources Information System) and data analysis tools.

- Quick response time to queries

- Collaboration in working with cross functional teams and solution oriented behavior

Skills / experience required:

- Reports, analytics and MIS and data driven decision-making skills.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Problem Solving and Critical Thinking, Collaborative, Influencing Skills

- Strong Networking skills Post Graduate

- Quick response time to queries

- Collaboration in working with cross functional teams and solution oriented behavior

title: HR Manager - EV Manufacturing Industry
description:
Job Title: Manager, Human Resources (Manufacturing)

Location: Bengaluru

Company Overview:

We are a leading player in the electric vehicle (EV) industry, dedicated to advancing sustainable and innovative mobility solutions. Headquartered in Bengaluru, we are at the forefront of shaping the future of transportation with our cutting-edge technology and commitment to environmental sustainability.

Position Overview:

We are seeking an experienced and dynamic individual to join our team as the Manager of Human Resources for our manufacturing division. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing HR strategies to support the growth and success of our EV venture. This position is based in Bengaluru and will report directly to the Director of Human Resources.

Responsibilities:

Strategic HR Planning:

- Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the company's overall business objectives and manufacturing goals.

- Collaborate with senior leadership to understand organizational needs and proactively provide HR solutions.

Talent Acquisition:

- Lead manufacturing roles' recruitment and onboarding process, ensuring a seamless and positive candidate experience.

- Develop strategies to attract top talent in the EV and manufacturing industry.

Employee Relations:

- Foster a positive work environment by promoting effective communication, employee engagement, and conflict resolution.

- Address employee concerns and grievances while ensuring compliance with company policies and applicable employment laws.

Performance Management:

- Implement performance management systems to enhance employee productivity and development.

- Work closely with department heads to establish performance goals and conduct regular performance reviews.

Training and Development:

- Identify training needs within the manufacturing team and design programs to enhance skills and knowledge.

- Support career development initiatives to retain and grow talent within the organization.

Compensation and Benefits:

- Manage and review compensation structures to ensure competitiveness in the market.

- Oversee benefits administration and recommend improvements to enhance the overall employee experience.

HR Compliance:

- Stay current with labour laws and regulations, ensuring compliance and implementing necessary changes.

- Conduct regular audits to ensure HR processes align with legal requirements.

HR Analytics:

- Utilize HR analytics to provide insights into workforce trends, turnover, and other key metrics.

- Make data-driven recommendations to improve organizational effectiveness.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree and HR certification preferred.

- Proven experience in HR management, preferably in the manufacturing sector.

- In-depth knowledge of employment laws and regulations in India.

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build positive relationships at all levels.

- Demonstrated experience in talent acquisition, performance management, and employee relations.

- Ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

title: Head - Human Resources - Real Estate
description:
HR Head


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Manpower Planning and Talent Acquisition (20%):

- Work with HODs and Finance Team to Budget manpower (as per Level, compensation and Phasing) to ensure optimum Headcount at all times.

- Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract top-tier talent.

- Collaborate with HODs and hiring managers to define job requirements and ensure a streamlined recruitment process.

- Ensure work towards superior employer Branding and communication of employee value proposition to prospective candidates

- Manage the end-to-end recruitment lifecycle, from sourcing and interviewing to onboarding.

Business Partnering (20 %):

- Proactively identify the support required by various functions on people matters including and not limited to - Performance Management, Issuance of Any PIPs, Probation - Confirmation review, Manpower deployment on achievement of various stages of Project life cycle

- Coach Business managers on how to get the maximum productivity from workforce and also groom them for larger roles at the same time

- Deployment of various people related SOPs to drive role clarity

- Foster a positive workplace culture through effective communication and conflict resolution.

- Oversee employee relations initiatives, ensuring fair and consistent application of policies.

- Address employee concerns and grievances in a timely and confidential manner.

Training and Development (10 %):

- Gather HOD feedback on Employee training requirement and design training programs through internal / external SMEs (subject matter experts) and trainers

- Work with recruitment team and Function Heads on Build vs Buy talent approach

- Implement career development initiatives to enhance employee skills and competencies.

- Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs.

Performance and Rewards (C&B) (10 %):

- Provide guidance to managers on KRA setting, performance feedback and improvement plans.

- Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess overall organizational performance.

- Implement and manage a robust performance management system.

- Develop and implement competitive compensation and benefits programs.

- Conduct market research to ensure the company's offerings remain competitive.

- Monitor and analyze compensation data to inform strategic decisions.

HR Transformation (10 %):

- Develop, update, and communicate HR policies, procedures and SOPs in line with Business and Audit requirements.

- Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations.

- Conduct regular audits to assess policy adherence.

- Ensure compliance with all internal policies and standards.

- Manage, oversee and leverage the HRIS system to ensure complete automation and minimum manual interventions

Employee Engagement (15 %):

- Proactively drive employee engagement initiatives to foster the culture of productivity and bonhomie in the workplace

- Track and publish Attrition - Retention dashboards. Present the same to Management and highlight any emerging concerns and action steps required to address the same.

- Conduct regular surveys and feedback sessions to gauge employee morale.

- Develop and implement strategies for Performance Evaluation, Staffing, Training, and Development, etc. Manage effectiveness in appraisal process, Promotions & Succession Planning

- Facilitate Cultural, Offsite, and fun activities (Monthly/Quarterly/Annual) within stipulated budget.

HR Operations (15%):

- Develop HR & Admin Annual Operating Plans (AOP) in collaboration with Senior Leaders, determining annual compensation costs per project and for the organization/business.

- Ensure meticulous tracking of budgets versus actuals monthly, reporting any variations/deviations, and obtaining necessary approvals.

- Ensure error free Payroll operations including Salary disbursement and other employee related financial matters and their reporting

- Manage and oversee the HRIS system to ensure complete automation and minimal manual interventions.

JOB SPECIFICATION:

- MBA in Human Resources with 12-16 years of experience in all aspects of Human Resources. Experience in Real Estate Industry will be an added advantage.

- Should have experience in Employee Communication and Leadership

- Should have exposure to grievance and disciplinary management and employee relations.

- Demonstrated ability to establish key relationships with business leaders.

- Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

- Excellent MS office skills like excel and ppt.

- Detail-oriented and persuasive

- Ability to work against tight deadlines.

title: Muthoot Fincorp - Lead - People Development
description:
Job Purpose:

The purpose of the role is to lead, design, and deliver the talent management framework in line with Muthoot Pappachan' s strategic objectives, Purpose, Mission, Vision, Values, and the Muthoot Health Triangle (Mental, Physical & Social Development). The incumbent is expected to execute strategic, tactical, and operational initiatives for leadership development, succession planning, career development, assessment & development center, total wellness, and top talent programs for talent retention & progression.

Key Job Responsibilities:

- Lead, Design & Deliver Total Wellness Programs

- Design a continuous wellness journey for Muthootians across the board around the three cornerstones of the Muthoot Health Triangle.

- Build an eco-system to support Muthootians in their medical, self-care & financial well-being.

- Build Muthoot Health Index framework to track the progress of the organization's total well-being.

- Build community programs, learning events, and platforms to improve the Physical, Mental & Social well-being of fellow Muthootians.

- Lead, Design & Deliver the Culture Journey

- Internalize the organization's purpose, vision, mission, and values by conducting culture bootcamps.

- Embed organization purpose and values across all talent practices designed for HIPO journeys

- Embed organization purpose and values in hiring and AC/DC practices.

- Lead Design & Deliver the Leadership Development Program

- Design & deploy an end-to-end framework for the growth of the leadership team (Man Com, Business Heads/ Functional Heads & their direct reports)

- Build a culture of strengths-based development for the leadership team

- Design a journey that entails a holistic development based on the 3 cornerstones of the Muthoot Health Triangle - Mental, Physical, and Social well-being

- Facilitate an individual development plan and help identify coaching support for the leadership team

- Build the leadership brand for Muthoot Blue, within and outside the organization

- Design and deploy leadership Audit in collaboration with OD Lead

- Collaborate with Head L&D to deploy learning journeys for the leadership group, based on their development plans

- Lead Design & Deliver Succession Planning & Career Development

- Design frameworks to identify critical roles in the organization, based on job evaluation scores and impact business continuity

- Define successor identification process and successor profiles to fill in for critical roles, including talent readiness in succession plans

- Design a clear path for all Critical roles, Successor profiles, and subsequently all roles across Muthoot Blue

- Provide visibility on a career path and development to every Muthootian, by designing a scientific progression path, using the job evaluation scores and parameters

- Create Ladder, Lattice & Hybrid career paths, thereby providing Muthootians with an opportunity to grow their professional aspiration with Muthoot Blue

- Lead Design & Deliver Assessment & Development Centres

- To build a robust competency framework for Muthoot Blue, with the KSA document clearly defining Job Family Competencies, Functional / Technical Competencies, and a Behavioral framework

- Define proficiency levels for competencies wherever required to assess, identify, and develop gaps/strengths

- Use the competency framework to design assessment and development centers for hiring new talent & developing existing talent at mid-management and entry-level leadership

- Design and train teams on Behaviorally anchored rating scale (BARS) to facilitate understanding and assessment of competencies in an AC /DC

- Train and calibrate with internally identified assessors, thereby building a pool of ready-to-deploy talent

- Conduct AC / DC validations before deploying them for hiring/ people development projects

Lead Design & Deliver Top Talent Programs for High Potential High-Performance Team Members

- Define a robust process, which is objectively designed to identify high-potential, high-performance Muthootians

- Use competency mapping, development centers, and organization objectives to define an end-to-end development journey for the top talent at Muthoot Blue.

- Collaborate with Head L&D to deploy learning journeys based on development center outcomes and IDPs for the top talent identified

- Design specific journeys for Business Talent and Functional Talent, to facilitate alignment with business objectives and individual career aspirations

- Define an exclusive club for the top talent which includes first in line for IJP, recognition programs, Live projects, Networking with leadership, etc.

Knowledge, Skills & Attributes:

- Applicable knowledge of Competency Mapping

- Designing & Implementing AC/DC

- Strong Networking Skills & Relationship Management

- Consultation & Communication (Written & Spoken) Skills

- Advanced MS Office application skills (Proficiency in PowerPoint & Excel)

- Knowledge of personality profiling (PPA/ DISC/MBTI etc)

- Basic Knowledge of Job Description & Job Evaluation process.

- Behavioral traits - A compassionate individual with a player attitude and a fearless approach towards open & honest conversations.

Role Requirements:

Educational Qualification - Graduate / Postgraduate, Desirable - MBA (HR)

Experience - Overall 10 years with 5 to 7 years of relevant experience in handling a similar role in a de-centralized matrix structure organization at a national role.

title: Amtex Systems - Vice President - Human Resources
description:
VP HR will be responsible for talent acquisition, onboarding, induction, performance management and Stakeholder Management. The position is a generalist profile handling whole gamut of Human Resources. HR business partners often operate on a senior level as they work most closely with management and leadership rather than with individuals.

Consults with line management, providing HR guidance when appropriate. Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs and policies. Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough and objective investigations. Aligning staff to business objectives, recruiting the right talent, enhancing staff performance, supporting employee development, enhancing recruitment efforts, planning strategic HR initiatives, managing HR consultants, running orientation and onboarding processes,

Competencies / Attributes:

- Problem Solving - Using generic or ad hoc methods, in an orderly manner, for finding solutions to problems.

- Active Listening - Ability to listen, comprehend & have an eye for details.

- Initiative - Ability to assess and take initiatives independently.

- Result Oriented - End Result Time-Bound Delivery.

- Decision Making - Effective decision making basic available information & experience.

- Interpersonal Sensitivity - Ability to communicate effectively with colleagues, stakeholders, team members & customers.

- Persuasiveness - Ability to convince stakeholders & team members

Roles and Responsibilities

Talent Acquisition & Stakeholder Management

- Maintain centralized database of budget, candidates , open and close requirements and track timelines and TAT to close positions managing whole cycle of recruitment.

- Campus Hiring and Branding through social Networking sites.

- Work with Stakeholders to design interview questions, written/IT tests, psychometric test, case studies, group discussions etc in line with the Personnel Specification and Job Description;

- Negotiation of salaries, finalizing and seeking approval and release of offer.

- Ensure that BG checking procedures are effective

Onboarding & Orientation

- Pre-inform about joining of employees and ensure, joining formalities are completed on the same day of joining.

- Ensure and track the initial orientation completion for all new joiners on a periodic basis and coordinating for induction .

- Provide all recruitment approvals, joining kit, new joiners information per requirement for updating in payroll.

HR Generalist

- Evaluation and Implementation of HRIS system

- Learning and Development initiatives of Organization

- Organization hierarchy design

- Statutory Compliance

- Expert support during all audits and inspections.

- Following ethical practices.

- Knowledge of timelines for adherence to the many laws and regulations.

- Fulfillment of the obligations by company or firm

Policy Management

- Implementing HR to policies will simplify the workforce management component of organization and final publication of employee handbooks to ensure that the company's policies reflect sound business principles.

People Culture/ Employee Relation and Engagement

- Undertake employee engagement activities -Partner with stakeholders across all sites to introduce new and exciting ways to motivate, engage and recognize and show appreciation for our employees.

- Develop, evaluate and implement new processes and communication channels to ensure employees are informed of company initiatives, programs, and announcements.

- Conducts Learning and development programs such as the Employee Rewards and Recognition programs and leadership development series.

- Consults with departments to develop programs and provide information designed to enhance employee engagement, team building foundations and cultural change initiatives

- To monitor adherence of policies.

- Key point in addressing grievances if any received from employees by escalating to appropriate channels.

- Organize Seminars/Sessions for Learning & Development.
